subject: O

cve O
request: O

command-line B-VUL
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
i'm O
typically O
uncomfortable O
assigning O
cves O
for O
such O
issues O
, O
since O
this O
makes O
the O
distinction O
between O
bugs O
and O
vulnerabilities O
even O
fuzzier O
than O
they O
already O
are O
, O
and O
potentially O
creates O
a O
"snowball O
effect O
" O
where O
suddenly O
cve O
sets O
a O
precedent O
and O
inadvertently O
grants O
legitimacy O
to O
large O
numbers O
of O
issues O
that O
are O
of O
very O
little O
security O
concern O
to O
most O
consumers O
. O
however O
, O
when O
there O
are O
common O
usage O
scenarios O
in O
which O
the O
product O
is O
used O
that O
produce O
a O
vulnerability O
, O
these O
have O
been O
given O
cves O
in O
the O
past O
. O
(non-exploitable O
browser O
crashers O
kind O
of O
fall O
under O
this O

, O
because O
of O
the O
common O
usage O

(1 O
) O
users O
will O
click O
on O

, O

(2 O
) O
users O
will O
have O

open O
, O
so O

crash O
will O

a O
long O
way O
of O
saying O
to O

for O

details O
as O
follows O
: O
a O
heap-based O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
was O
found O
in O
the O
way O
libjpeg-turbo B-PRO
decompressed O
certain O
corrupt O

images O
in O

the O
component O

was O

to O

to O

in O

other O

or O
do O

do O
similar O
? O
it O
seems O
that O
, O
strictly O
speaking O
, O
the O
"critical O
" O
nature O
of O
this O
vulnerability O
hinges O
on O
the O
behaviour O
of O
the O
browser/desktop O
environment O
. O
otherwise O
the O
scope O
is O
limited O
to O
an O
individual O
manually O

and O
opening O
it O
outside O
of O
the O
browser O
. O
evince O
installs O
a O
thumbnail O
entry O
to O
usr/share/thumbnailers O
this O
is O
a O
generic O
location O
where O
applications O
can O
install O
files O
(i O
believe O
they O
follow O
the O
.desktop O
specification O
, O
which O
is O
an O
ini-based O
format). O
this O
is O
thus O
not O
nautilus-specific O
, O
but O
every O
filemanager O
that O
uses O
this O
format O
will O
be O
affected O
. O
a O
quick O
googling O
tells O
me O
e.g O
. O
pcmanfm O
is O
also O
affected O
. O
i'm O
not O
sure O
if O
dolphin O
uses O
them O
as O
well O
. O

is O
trying O
to O
solve O
this O
by O
sandboxing O
the O
thumbnailers O
. O
however O
this O
depends O
on O
bubblewrap O
and O
is O
currently O
fail-open O
, O
i.e O
. O
if O
bubblewrap O
is O
not O
available O
it O
will O
not O
disable O

will O
just O
not O

it O
. O
in O
practice O
this O
means O
it's O
often O
not O
sandboxed O
. O
i O
doubt O
this O
will O
change O
any O
time O
soon O
. O
very O
similar O
problems O
show O
up O
with O
desktop O
search O
tools O
. O
i O
think O
this O
whole O
concept O
is O
questionable O
and O
should O
be O
reviewed O
. O
i O
think O
it's O
not O

to O

. O

or O

things O
tavis O
found O
in O
ghostscript). O

that O

subject: O
re: O
please O
reject O
cve-2015-3199 O
begin O
pgp O
signed O
message O
hash O
: O
"this O
was O
reported O
by O
ori O
rabin O
to O
foreman-security O
(thanks!) O
and O
a O
cve O
identifier O
was O
filed O
under O
cve-2015-3199 O
, O
but O
it O
turned O
out O
this O
does O
not O
affect O
any O
released O
upstream O
version O
. O
so O
it O
was O
effectively O
in O
an O
unreleased O
version O
, O
thus O
no O
need O
for O
cve O
. O
the O
scope O
of O
cve O
isn't O
strictly O
limited O
to O
released O
upstream O
versions O
. O
as O
mentioned O
at O
the O
bottom O
of O
the O
http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/01/04/7 O
post O
, O
some O
products O
sometimes O
have O
cves O
for O
this O
type O
of O
unreleased O
software O
, O
whereas O
others O
do O
not O
. O
we O
feel O
that O
foreman O
is O
probably O
in O
the O
latter O
category O
. O
http://theforeman.org/contribute.html O
and O
10469 O
suggest O
that O
the O
incorrect O
code O
was O
found O
only O
on O
the O
develop O
branch O
: O
- O
master O
- O
latest O
stable O
release O
code O
- O
develop O
- O
new O
features O
and O
bug O
fixes O
master O
is O
frozen O
between O
major O
releases O
. O

def O

, O

, O
cover_fname O
, O
raise_on_error): O
"""make O
a O
cc O
file O
for O
us O
to O
use O
for O
per-commit O
cc O
automation O
also O
stores O
in O

to O
make O

faster O
. O

: O

: O

tags O
as O
if O
they O
were O
aliases O

: O
if O
non-none O
the O
name O
of O
the O
cover O
letter O
. O

to O
raise O
an O
error O
when O
an O
alias O
fails O
to O
match O

to O
just O
print O
a O
message O
. O

: O

of O
temp O
file O
created O

# O

for O

(of O

'xxx:' O
at O

start O
of O
the O
subject O

= O
' O

\( O
my O
$pci_file O
= O

' O

this O
block O
to O
be O

subject: O
re: O
cve O
affected O
for O
php B-PRO
5.3.9 B-VER
? O
can O
you O
provide O
a O
reproducer O
(vuln O
script O
and O
a O
malicious O
input O
) O
that O
shows O
this O
in O
action O
(e.g O
. O
creates O
a O
local O
php B-PRO
file). O

find O
attached O

"php539-xslt.php O
" O
script O
. O
this O
script O
displays O
by O
default O
a O
pre-filled O
html O
form O
including O
some O
xml O
data O
and O
xslt O
code O
. O
when O

form O
is O
submitted O
, O

xml O
data O
is O
transformed O
using O
the O
user-controlled O
xslt O
code O
. O
then O
, O
the O
output O
of O
this O
transformation O
is O
displayed O
in O
the O
browser O
. O
when O

code O
will O
write O
to O

payload O
is O

("simple_demo") O
embedded O
in O

code O
is O
used O
to O
decrypt O
it O
. O

subject: O

linux B-PRO

a O
null O
pointer O
hello O
, O
a O
null O
pointer B-VUL
dereference I-VUL
in O
dccp_write_xmit() B-VULPART
function O
in O
net/dccp/output.c B-VULPART
in O
the O
linux B-PRO
kernel I-PRO
before B-VER
v4.16-rc7 I-VER
allows O
a O
local O
user O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
by O
a O
number O
of O
certain O
crafted O
system O
calls O
. O
so O
the O
classic O
cve O
statement O
for O
this O
is O
" O
does O
it O
cross/violate O
a O
trust O
boundary". O
yeah O
i O
know O
, O
not O
super O
helpful O
. O
in O
general O
when O
i O
look O
at O
something O
and O
need O
to O
decide O
whether O
or O
not O
it O
deserves/needs O
a O
cve O
the O
fundamentals O
are O
: O
1 O
) O
can O
an O
attacker O
use O
this O
vulnerability O
to O
gain O
access O
, O
additional O
privileges O
, O
basically O
is O
there O
an O
impact O
to O
confidentiality/availability/integrity O
? O
this O
is O
really O
two O
tests O
: O
is O
there O
an O
impact O
, O
and O
is O
there O
a O
way O
for O

attacker O
to O
trigger O
or O
exploit O
it O
? O
does O
the O
software/system O
make O
a O
specific O
security O
claim O
that O
they O
then O
fail O
to O
meet O
? O
e.g O

"we O
include O

that O
blocks O

to O

) O

) O

trigger O

? O

cve O
is O
warranted O
. O
hi O
kurt O
, O
perhaps O
i O
should've O
been O
more O

. O

wasn't O

"what O

: O

was O

written O
in O

subject: O
re: O
lxdm B-PRO
x O
authentication O
issues O
begin O
pgp O
signed O
message O
hash O
: O
sha256 O
lxdm B-PRO
before B-VER
0.5.2 I-VER
did O
not O
start O
x O
server O
with O
-auth O
parameter O
. O
therefore O
any O
user O
able O
to O
connect O
to O
it O
(typically O
all O
local O
users O
) O
would O
have O
their O
x O
connections O
accepted O
. O

issue O
was O
fixed O
via O
: O
http://git.lxde.org/gitweb/?p=lxde/lxdm.git;a=commit;h=e8f387089e241360bdc6955d3e479450722dcea3 O
pass O
xauth O
file O
to O
xserver O
command O
it O
appears O
that O
this O
is O
the O
major O
finding O
. O
use O
cve-2015-8308 O
. O
lxdm B-PRO
also O
defaults O
to O
not O
restarting O
x O
server O
between O
sessions O
, O
and O
does O
not O
change O
authentication O

or O
remove O
xhost O
authorizations O
. O

allows O
local O
user O
to O
be O

to O
connect O
to O
the O
x O

controls O

was O

to O
make O

required O
behavior O

subject: O
lynx B-PRO
lynxcgi B-PRO
handler O
flaw O
clint O
ruoho O
brought O
this O
to O
our O
attention O
, O
and O
i O
think O

is O
a O
greater O
benefit O
in O
in O
sharing O
this O
than O
there O
is O
in O
keeping O
it O

. O
the O
fix O
for O
cve-2005-2929 O
only O
disable O
the O
lynxcgi B-PRO
handler O
when O
you're O
not O
in O
advanced O
mode O
. O
it's O
considered O
to O
not O
be O
a O
flaw O
in O
advanced O
mode O
because O
it O
displays O
the O
url O
that O
is O
selected O
. O
the O
potential O

here O

is O

is O

to O

just O
disable O
cgi O
support O
in O
/etc/lynx.cfg B-VULPART
, O
which O
i O
agree O
with O

is O

default O
. O

was O

, O

. O

. O
evince O

to O

this O

a O
generic O
location O
where O
applications O
can O
install O

believe O
they O

pcmanfm O
is O

affected O
. O

uses O

as O

. O

is O

to O

this O
by O

thumbnailers O
. O
however O
this O
depends O
on O

and O
is O
currently O
fail-open O
, O
i.e O
. O

in O
practice O

means O

not O

. O
i O
doubt O

will O
change O
any O

. O

with O
desktop O
search O
tools O
. O

think O
this O

. O

subject: O
re: O
cve-2016-0634 O
-- O
bash B-PRO
prompt O
expanding O
$hostname O
all O
, O
a O
little O
while O
ago O
, O

users O
discovered O
that O

would O
run O
"something O
unpleasant O
" O
when O

expanded O
\h O
in O
the O
prompt O
string O
. O
i O
finally O
got O
this O
message O
, O
three O
hours O
later O
. O
i O
assume O
you're O
using O
$hostname O
as O
a O
shorthand O
; O
bash B-PRO
only O
uses O
the O
return O
value O
from O
gethostname(). B-VULPART
it's O
unlikely O
that O
something O
like O
this O
could O
be O

without O
existing O
privilege O
. O
if O
you O
have O

server O
on O
your O

, O

do O

that O

one O

id O
. O

" O

subject: O
cve-2018-1118 O
linux B-PRO
kernel: I-PRO

information B-VUL
disclosure I-VUL
in O
vhost/vhost.c:vhost_new_msg() B-VULPART
from O
: O
wade O
mealing O
<wmealing@...hat.com O
to O
: O
oss-security@...ts.openwall.com O
gday O
, O
a O
flaw O
was O
found O
in O
the O
vhost_new_msg() B-VULPART
function O
which O
does O
not O
properly O
initialize O
memory O
in O
messages O
passed O
between O
virtual O
guests O
and O
the O
host O
operating O
system O
. O

can O
allow O
local O

users O
to O
read O
previously O
set O
kernel O
memory O
contents O
when O
reading O
from O
the O

device O

. O

would O
be O

as O

leak I-VUL
that O
could O
be O
used O
to O
defeat O
other O
protection O

can O

wade O
mealing O
product O
security O
- O

, O
rhce O

for O
a O
number O
of O
reasons O
. O
maybe O
python O
"should O
" O
get O
the O
cve O
, O
but O
the O

to O
push O
the O
issue O
to O
application O
developers O
means O
that O

developers O
will O

and O

to O
track O
these O
related O

at O
the O
application O
level O
. O
(one O
could O

about O

design O

in O

subject: O
re: O
cve-request O
-- O
efront B-PRO
v. B-VER
3.6.15.2 I-VER
build O
18021 O
(community O
edition) O
-- O
multiple O
csrf B-VUL
vulnerabilities O
begin O
pgp O
signed O
message O
hash O
: O
sha1 O
i O
found O
multiple O
csrf B-VUL
vulnerabilities O
... O
use O
cve-2015-1559 O
for O
all O
of O
the O
csrf B-VUL
vulnerabilities O
. O
the O
components O
being O
used O
for O
creating O
the O
auto-login O
token O
are O
the O
following O
informations O
: O
- O
a O
salt O
- O
the O
accounts O
creation O
date O
- O
the O
username O
the O
salt O
isn't O
generated O
dynamically O
during O
the O
installation O
. O
on O
a O
common O
efront B-PRO
installation O
without O
any O
changes O
by O
the O
administrator O
, O
it O
has O
the O
value O
cdwqr#$rcxsc O
. O
the O
admin O
accounts O
creation O
date O
has O
the O
standard O
value O
1365149958 O
. O
as O
the O
standard O
administrators O
accountname O
is O
"admin", O
the O
auto-login O
token O
for O
the O
administrators O
account O
of O
efront B-PRO
has O
always O
the O
value O
eb514ea3c45d74a1218e207fb4b345b1 O
if O
the O
precondition O
is O
fulfilled O
this O
token-creation O
approach O
is O
arguably O
an O
undesirable O
behavior O
, O
but O
it O
does O
not O
have O
a O
cve O
id O
. O
the O
existence O
of O
the O
eb514ea3c45d74a1218e207fb4b345b1 O
value O
does O
not O
provide O
access O
unless O
an O
autologin=1 O
request O
is O
sent O
within O
an O
administrative O
session O
. O
this O
issue O
is O
relevant O
mainly O
when O
a O
csrf B-VUL
vulnerability O
exists O
. O
this O
new O
tab O
allows O
to O
select O
the O
users O
that O
may O
autologin O
to O
the O
system O
via O
a O
simple O
link O
. O
useful O
for O
guest O
users O
but O
there O
are O
many O
others O
uses O
as O
well O
. O
we O
do O
not O
think O
that O
intentionally O
setting O
up O
autologin O
for O
an O
administrator O
is O
a O
common O
or O
plausible O
use O
case O
. O
if O
autologin O
had O
been O
enabled O
for O
any O
other O
user O
account O
, O
the O
attacker O
would O
apparently O
need O
to O
know O
both O
the O
username O
and O
the O
account's O
creation O
date O
. O
better O
salting O
would O
be O
an O
opportunity O
for O
security O
improvement O
. O
accounts O
that O
would O
realistically O
be O
configured O
for O
autologin O
are O
probably O
not O
high-value O
accounts O
, O
and O
the O
salt O
choice O
could O
be O
a O
security-versus-complexity O
tradeoff O
. O
-- O
cve O
assignment O
team O
, O
mitre O
cve O
numbering O
authority O
m/s O
end O
pgp O
signature O

of O
ease O
of O
exploitation O
, O
this O
one O
has O
to O
be O
in O
the O
very O
difficult O
basket O
. O
i O
agree O
, O
this O
would O
be O
difficult O
to O
exploit O
. O
it's O
better O
to O
be O
safe O
than O
sorry O
. O
that's O
why O
i O
rushed O
out O
a O
new O
release O
. O
i O
do O
take O
this O
seriously O
, O
but O
i O
do O
not O
like O
to O
see O
the O
threat O
exaggerated O
beyond O
reason O
. O
i O
didn't O
mean O
to O
imply O
we O
should O
be O
panicking O
and O
running O
for O
the O
hills O
. O
just O
that O
the O
assessment O
that O
this O
is O
*potentially O
* O
exploitable O
for O
code O
execution O
is O
accurate O
and O
is O
most O
helpful O
to O
distributions O
and O
users O
when O
gauging O
risk O
and O
determining O
when O
to O
release O
and O
apply O
updates O
. O

subject: O

on O

+0100 O
, O
hanno O

wrote O
: O
hi O
, O
during O
the O
troopers O
conference O
this O
week O
an O
unpatched O
vulnerability O
in O
squirrelmail B-PRO
was O
presented O
by O
florian O
grunow O
from O
ernw O
[1]. O
the O
issue O
is O
that O
when O
uploading O
a O
mail O
attachment O

temporary O
file O
is O
generated O
on O
the O
server O
that O
the O
client O
later O
references O
when O
sending O

. O

is O
not O

in O
any O

, O
so O

a O
filename O
of O
the O
form O
".. O

can O
use O

to O
attach O
arbitrary O
files O
from O
the O

that O
can O
be O
accessed O
by O

. O

who O
has O

could O
use O

to O
exfiltrate O

and O

as O
attachments O
. O

is O
unfixed O
. O

say O
they O
tried O
to O
reach O

to O

were O

to O
contact O
them O
. O
squirrelmail B-PRO
hasn't O
had O
a O
release O
for O
many O
years O
and O

webpage O
has O

last O

from O

. O

that O
until O

subversion O

and O

provided O

, O

. O
a O
2017 O
found O
injection O
vuln O
[2 O
] O
was O
fixed O
. O
despite O
its O
stale O
state O

still O
use O
squirrelmail B-PRO
, O
in O
my O

it O
works O
better O
than O
alternatives O
like O
roundcube O
in O

where O

have O
very O
weak O
internet O
connections O
. O

created O
a O
preliminary O

and O
dirty O
patch O
that O
should O
close O

[3]. O

guarantees O

only O
contains O
letters O
and O
numbers O
(this O
should O
be O
okay O

contain O
any O

in O

operation O
) O
and O
otherwise O
just O
terminates O

process O
. O

do O
is..." O
but O
the O
reality O
is O
"we O
should O
fix O
this O
centrally O
rather O
than O
try O
to O
make O
everyone O
do O
the O
right O
thing O
(aka O
boiling O
the O
ocean)". O
this O
is O
like O
tmp O
vulns O
, O
it's O
2014 O
, O
the O
solution O
for O
tmp O
vulns O
is O
polyinstantiated O
/tmp O
per O
user O
, O
and O
per O
application O
/tmp O
dirs O
in O
addition O
to O
this O
. O
solve O
it O
once O
centrally O
(e.g O
. O
in O
pam/systemd O
) O
and O
boom O
, O
done O
. O
we O
should O
always O
try O
to O
do O
the O
best/safest O
thing O
because O
most O
devs O
are O
going O
to O
try O
to O
do O
the O
most O
insanely O
dangerous O
thing O
. O
that's O
the O
first O
sensible O
thing O
i've O
read O
on O
this O
whole O
topic O
:) O
cheers O
, O
peter O
http://www.more-magic.net O

subject: O
re: O
bug#668667: O
cve O
request O
(minor) O
-- O
two O
munin B-PRO
graphing O
jan O
lieskovsky O
in O
addition O
munin B-PRO
parses O
parts O
of O

query O
string O
. O

to O
modify O
the O

of O

. O

".... O

" O

can O
do O

same O
attack O

simultaneously O

a O
large O
image O

. O

would O
be O
381m O
(assuming O
8bits/pixel O
) O

this O
case O

likely O
be O
smaller O

now O

of O

. O

that O

can O

to O

subject: O
re: O

from O
memory O

signed O

hash O
: O

. O

"this O
is O

(also O
, O

private-key O

is O

. O

: O
- O

a O

what O

should O

function O
names O
that O
can O
be O
confused O
with O
pathnames O
. O
please O
chime O
in O
and O
let O
me O
know O
what O
you O
think O

sorry O
, O
i O
should O
have O
added O
that O
i'm O
not O

in O

subject: O
re: O
cve-2014-6271: O
remote O
code O
execution O
through O
bash B-PRO
florian O
weimer O
: O
chet O
ramey O
, O
the O
gnu O
bash B-PRO
upstream O
maintainer O
, O
will O
soon O
release O
official O
upstream O
patches O
. O
http://ftp.gnu.org/pub/gnu/bash/bash-3.1-patches/bash31-018 O
http://ftp.gnu.org/pub/gnu/bash/bash-3.2-patches/bash32-052 O
http://ftp.gnu.org/pub/gnu/bash/bash-4.0-patches/bash40-039 O
http://ftp.gnu.org/pub/gnu/bash/bash-4.1-patches/bash41-012 O
http://ftp.gnu.org/pub/gnu/bash/bash-4.2-patches/bash42-048 O
http://ftp.gnu.org/pub/gnu/bash/bash-4.3-patches/bash43-025 O
someone O
has O
posted O
large O
parts O
of O
the O
prenotification O
as O
a O
news O
article O
, O
so O
in O
the O
interest O
of O
full O
disclosure O
, O
here O
is O
what O
we O
wrote O
to O
the O
non-vendors O
(vendors O
also O
received O
patches): O
debian O
and O
other O
gnu/linux O
vendors O
plan O
to O
disclose O
a O
critical O
, O
remotely O
exploitable O
security O
vulnerability O
in O
bash B-PRO
this O
week O
, O
related O
to O
the O
processing O
of O
environment O
variables O
. O
stephane O
chazelas O
discovered O
it O
, O
and O
cve-2014-6271 O
has O
been O
assigned O
to O
it O
. O
the O
issue O
is O
currently O
under O
embargo O
(not O
public), O
and O
you O
receive O
this O
message O
as O
a O
courtesy O
notification O
because O
we O
assume O
that O
you O
have O
network-based O
filtering O
capabilities O
, O
so O
that O
you O
can O
work O
on O
ways O
to O
protect O
a O
significant O
number O
of O
customers O
. O
however O
, O
you O
should O
not O
yet O
distribute O
ips/ids O
signatures O
, O
publicly O
or O
to O
customers O
. O
at O
present O
, O
public O
disclosure O
is O
scheduled O
for O
wednesday O
, O
2014-09-24 O
14:00 O
utc O
. O
we O
do O
not O
expect O
the O
schedule O
to O
change O
, O
but O
we O
may O
be O
forced O
to O
revise O
it O
. O
the O
technical O
details O
of O
the O
vulnerability O
follow O
. O
bash B-PRO
supports O
exporting O
not O
just O
shell O
variables O
, O
but O
also O
shell O
functions O
to O
other O
bash B-PRO
instances O
, O
via O
the O
process O
environment O
to O
(indirect O
) O
child O
processes O
. O
current O
bash B-PRO
versions O
use O
an O
environment O
variable O
named O
by O
the O
function O
name O
, O
and O
a O
function O
definition O
starting O
with O
() O
{ O
in O
the O
variable O
value O
to O
propagate O
function O
definitions O
through O
the O
environment O
. O
the O
vulnerability O
occurs O
because O
bash B-PRO
does O
not O
stop O
after O
processing O
the O
function O
definition O
; O
it O
continues O
to O
parse O
and O
execute O
shell O
commands O
following O
the O
function O
definition O
. O
for O
example O
, O
an O
environment O
variable O
setting O
of O
var=() O
{ O
ignored O
; O
}; O
/bin/id O
will O
execute O
/bin O
/id O
when O
the O
environment O
is O
imported O
into O
the O
bash B-PRO
process O
. O
(the O
process O
is O
in O
a O
slightly O
undefined O
state O
at O
this O
point O
. O
the O
path O
variable O
may O
not O
have O
been O
set O
up O
yet O
, O
and O
bash B-PRO
could O
crash O
after O
executing O
/bin/id O
, O
but O
the O
damage O
has O
already O
happened O
at O
this O
point.) O
the O
fact O
that O
an O
environment O
variable O
with O
an O
arbitrary O
name O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
carrier O
for O
a O
malicious O
function O
definition O
containing O
trailing O
commands O
makes O
this O
vulnerability O
particularly O
severe O
; O
it O
enables O
network-based O
exploitation O
. O
so O
far O
, O
http O
requests O
to O
cgi O
scripts O
have O
been O
identified O
as O
the O
major O
attack O
vector O
. O
a O
typical O
http O
request O
looks O
like O
this O
: O
get O
/path?query-param-name=query-param-value O
http/1.1 O
host O
: O
www.example.com O
the O
cgi O
specification O
maps O
all O
parts O
to O
environment O
variables O
. O
with O
apache O
httpd O
, O
the O
magic O
string O
() O
{ O
can O
appear O
in O
these O
places O
: O
host O
(www.example.com, O
as O
remote_host O
) O
header O
value O
(custom-header-value, O
as O
http_custom O
in O
this O
example O
) O
server O
protocol O
(http/1.1, O
as O
server_protocol O
) O
the O
user O
name O
embedded O
in O
an O
authorization O
header O
could O
be O
a O
vector O
as O
well O
, O
but O
the O
corresponding O
remote_user O
variable O
is O
only O
set O
if O
the O
user O
name O
corresponds O
to O
a O
known O
account O
according O
to O
the O
authentication O
configuration O
, O
and O
a O
configuration O
which O
accepts O
the O
magic O
string O
appears O
somewhat O
unlikely O
. O
in O
addition O
, O
with O
other O
cgi O
implementations O
, O
the O
request O
method O
(get), O
path O
(/path) O
and O
query O
string O
(query-param-name=query-param-value) O
may O
be O
vectors O
, O
and O
it O
is O
conceivable O
for O
query-param-value O
as O
well O
, O
and O
perhaps O
even O
query-param-name. O
the O
other O
vector O
is O
openssh O
, O
either O
through O
acceptenv O
variables O
, O
term O
or O
ssh_original_command O
. O
other O
vectors O
involving O
different O
environment O
variable O
set O
by O
additional O
programs O
are O
expected O
. O
again O
, O
please O
do O
not O
disclose O
this O
issue O
to O
customers O
or O
the O
general O
public O
until O

embargo O
has O
expired O
. O

subject: O
cve O
guidance O
for O
libraries O
and O
resource-consumption O
dos O
there's O
too O
much O
to O
consider.) O
the O
recent O
discussions O
about O
xxe O
and O
related O
issues O
have O
touched O
upon O
a O
number O
of O
issues O
that O
must O
be O
considered O
for O
cve O
assignment O
. O
inclusion O
(deciding O
whether O
to O
assign O
a O
cve O
or O
not): O
whether O
an O
"insecure O
default O
configuration O
" O
in O
a O
library O
should O
receive O
a O
cve O
. O
how O
to O
draw O
the O
line O
between O

"resource-consumption O
dos O
" O
and O
acceptable O
, O
"normal O
" O

that O
just O
happens O
to O
be O

. O
abstraction O
(deciding O

cves O
to O

whether O
a O

cve O
is O
assigned O
to O
a O
security O
concern O
in O
a O
library O
, O
or O
whether O

applications O
using O

should O
receive O
their O
own O
cves O
. O
when O
multiple O
issues O
are O
"new O
types O
" O
of O
vulnerabilities O
(or O
not O
well-understood O
types), O
it O
can O
be O
difficult O
to O
consistently O
decide O
when O
to O
split O
or O
merge O
. O
such O
"new O
types O
" O
often O
spawn O
variants O
or O
are O
described O
poorly O
, O
so O
it O
can O
take O
some O

before O

and O
terminology O
stabilizes O
. O
while O
dos O
issues O
have O
been O
around O
for O
ages O
, O
their O
underlying O
root O
causes O
have O
not O
been O
studied O
as O
closely O
as O
issues O
like O
buffer B-VUL
overflows I-VUL
, O
so O
it O
can O
be O
difficult O
to O
consistently O
classify O
different O
dos O
issues O
as O
different O
types O
. O
when O
clarifying O
cve O
content O
decisions O
, O
we O
often O
have O
to O
consider O
how O
useful O
they O
may O
be O
to O

cve-using O
public O
; O
how O
practical O
they O
will O
be O
to O
implement O
without O
extensive O
, O
labor-intensive O
analysis O
or O
expertise O
; O
how O
much O
they O
capture O
the O
"spirit O
" O
of O
past O
content O
decisions O
; O
and O
whether O
we O
believe O
they O
could O
cause O
practical O
problems O
in O
the O
future O
without O
sufficient O
benefit O
(the O
so-called O
"snowball O
effect O
" O
i've O
touched O
on O
before). O
because O
cve O
is O
used O
so O
widely O
by O
many O
communities O
, O
we O
have O
sometimes O
had O
to O
accept O
improperly-applied O
content O
decisions O
instead O
of O
rejecting O
the O
cves O
outright O
. O
we O
do O
not O
view O
such O

as O
establishing O
a O
precedent O
. O
a O

(the O

. O
(i O

should O

this O

may O
occur O

, O
so O
- O
assignment O
of O
past O
cves O
does O
not O
imply O
a O
blind O
commitment O
to O
be O
consistent O
in O
the O
future O
just O
because O
there O
is O
a O
precedent O
. O
note O
that O
, O
when O

a O
"novel O
" O
situation O
- O
or O
, O
at O
least O

a O

that O
is O
rarely O

- O

will O
sometimes O
take O

"wait O

" O
approach O
by O
doing O
things O
one O
way O
, O
and O
then O
(later O
) O

. O
while O
this O
is O
not O
ideal O
and O
can O

to O
some O

, O
the O

is O
that O
we O
have O
to O

cve O

to O
real-world O

now O
, O
and O
the O

that O
work O
for O
the O
short O
term O
might O
not O
necessarily O
be O
ideal O
in O
the O
long O
run O
. O
in O
some O
cases O
, O
the O
entire O
community O
might O
not O
understand O
the O
issues O
well O
enough O
. O
of O
course O
, O
we O
always O
try O
to O
be O
right O
the O
first O
time O
, O
or O
at O
least O
after O
a O
couple O
examples O
have O
come O
up O
that O
raise O
awareness O
of O
the O
broader O
context O
. O
as O
a O
side O
note O
- O
i O
believe O
that O
the O
increase O
in O
chained O
exploits O
and O
overall O
complexity O
will O
pose O
additional O

for O
vulnerability O
classification O
, O
vuln O
tracking O
, O
and O
vuln O
databases O
in O
the O
future O
. O
as O
vulnerabilities O
become O
more O
complex O
, O
we O
are O
likely O
to O
revisit O
some O
of O
these O
content O
decisions O
. O
cve's O
"traditional O
" O
approach O
for O
libraries O
in O
general O
, O
when O
an O
issue O
appears O
to O
occur O
in O
a O
library O
, O
we O
determine O
whether O
an O
application O
developer O
can O
use O
the O
library O
safely O
, O
or O
whether O
there O
is O
no O
way O
to O
use O
it O
safely O
. O
if O
the O
library O
can't O
be O
used O
safely O
at O
all O
- O
then O
we O
would O
regard O
that O
as O
an O
issue O
in O
the O
library O
. O
we O
would O
assign O
a O
single O
cve O
to O
that O
library O
, O
and O
we O
don't O
assign O
any O
new O
cves O
to O
applications O
that O
use O
the O
vulnerable O
library O
. O
if O
the O
developer O
has O
an O
opportunity O
to O
use O
the O
library O
correctly O
, O
but O
doesn't O
, O
then O
we O
treat O
this O
as O
a O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
application O
. O
two O
classic O
examples O
of O
"library O
" O
problems O
are O
the O
c O
strcpy() O
function O
and O
the O
php O
include() O
function O
. O
both O
of O
these O
functions O
have O
been O
responsible O
for O
hundreds O
or O
thousands O
of O
vulnerabilities O
in O
applications O
, O
but O
they O
can O
both O
be O
used O
safely O
if O
the O
programmer O
calls O
them O
properly O
(perhaps O
after O
some O
input O
validation O
or O
equivalent O
protection O
mechanism). O
accordingly O
, O
we O
don't O
have O
just O
one O
cve O
for O
strcpy() O
and O
one O
cve O
for O
include() O
- O
we O
have O
hundreds O
of O
cves O
for O
the O
applications O
that O
happen O
to O
use O
these O
functions O
insecurely O
. O
with O
some O
libraries O
, O
however O
, O
the O
developer O
might O
not O
be O
able O
to O
have O
the O
same O
high O
degree O
of O
control O
in O
avoiding O
a O
vulnerability O
; O
more O
details O
later O
in O
this O
document O
. O
the O
boundaries O
between O
library O
and O
application O
responsibility O
can O
sometimes O
be O
blurred O
. O
for O
example O
, O
we O
have O
created O
some O
cves O
for O
buffer B-VUL
overflows I-VUL
or O
similar O
errors O
in O
php O
api O
functions O
where O
the O
programmer O
would O
almost O
never O
be O
expected O
to O
call O
the O
function O
with O
untrusted O
input O
. O
libraries O
are O
"special O
" O
because O
they O
can O
be O
used O
by O
many O
different O
applications O
, O
in O
many O
different O
ways O
, O
and O
this O
can O
further O
complicate O
decisions O
. O
for O
example O
, O
a O
"secure O
fix O
" O
for O
one O
appliction O
developer O
could O
harm O
usability O
for O
a O
different O
developer O
. O
the O
perils O
of O
preserving O
a O
bad O
api O
are O
equalled O
only O
by O
the O
perils O
of O
changing O
an O
established O
api O
. O
note O
that O
i'm O
personally O
very O
interested O
in O
issues O
of O
api O
design O
, O
and O
how O
api O
design O
choices O
can O
make O
it O
easier O
for O
application O
developers O
to O
introduce O
vulnerabilities O
, O
but O
from O
a O
cve O
perspective O
, O
these O
interests O
are O
mostly O
irrelevant O
. O
in O
general O
, O
we O
want O
cve O
to O
only O
cover O
specific O
, O
"actionable O
" O
problems O
instead O
of O
general O
warnings O
about O
secure O
coding O
. O
xxe O
etc O
. O
- O
clarification O
on O
vulnerability O
types O
i'm O
going O
to O
address O
the O
easier O
issues O
first O
. O
namely O
: O
we O
regard O
(1 O
) O
entity O
expansion O
(aka O
billion-laughs O
or O
xee O
) O
and O
(2 O
) O
external O
entity O
references O
to O
remote O
http://, O
file://, O
or O
other O
urls O
(aka O
xxe O
) O
to O
be O
distinct O
vulnerability O
types O
, O
and O
thus O
worth O
a O
split O
. O
some O
of O
the O
recent O
disclosures O
cover O
additional O
issues O
that O
might O
be O
regarded O
as O
different O
types O
besides O
xxe/xxe O
(dtd O
retrieval O
, O
xpath O
support O
, O
xslt O
support O
, O
xinclude O
support). O
these O
will O
need O
to O
be O
investigated O
in O
more O
detail O
before O
cve O
assignments O
can O
be O
completed O
. O
in O
some O
cases O
, O
where O
there O
are O
two O
types O
of O
dos O
, O
they O
might O
be O
worth O
a O
split O
. O
there O
are O
clear O
cases O
like O
a O
null O
pointer O
dereference O
crash O
versus O
a O
reachable O
assertion O
or O
divide O
by O
zero O
. O
areas O
of O
algorithmic O
complexity O
, O
however O
, O
are O
not O
as O
well O
explored O
. O
this O
is O
sometimes O
a O
judgment O
call O
, O
which O
can O
introduce O
variation O
in O
how O
pepole O
decide O
whether O
to O
split O
or O
merge O
. O
an O
issue O
like O
an O
infinite O
loop O
(cpu O
and O
maybe O
memory O
consumption O
) O
might O
be O
different O
than O
another O
issue O
like O
uncontrolled O
memory O
allocation O
(just O
memory O
consumption O
, O
although O
the O
cpu O
and O
disk O
might O
get O
pretty O
busy O
too). O
in O
scenarios O
such O
as O
this O
, O
one O
general O
guideline O
is O
to O
consider O
whether O
the O
apparent O
fix O
for O
one O
issue O
will O
necessarily O
fix O
the O
other O
issue O
. O
if O
you O
have O
infinite O
recursion O
, O
then O
fixing O
it O
by O
limiting O
the O
recursion O
depth O
would O
not O
do O
anything O
against O
an O
uncontrolled O
memory O
allocation O
, O
so O
this O
would O
probably O
be O
worth O
a O
split O
. O
kurt O
- O
in O
http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/02/20/10 O
you O
referred O
to O
"linear O
expansion." O
if O
you O
mean O
the O
"quadratic O
blowup O
entity O
expansion O
" O
as O
documented O
on O
http://blog.python.org/2013/02/announcing-defusedxml-fixes-for-xml.html O
, O
we O
are O
not O
sure O
whether O
this O
could O
be O
treated O
as O
different O
than O
billion O
laughs O
. O
it's O
very O
likely O
that O
an O
implementation O
may O
fix O
billion-laughs O
in O
a O
way O
that O
does O
not O
also O
fix O
"quadratic O
blowup O
" O
issues O
; O
as O
the O
blog O
points O
out O
, O
this O
attack O
can O
"avoid O
triggering O
countermeasures O
of O
parsers O
against O
heavily O
nested O
entities." O
so O
, O
we O
are O
likely O
to O
see O
fixes O
for O
one O
variant O
, O
then O
a O
new O
software O
package O
will O
get O
hit O
with O
the O
other O
variant O
- O
at O
best O
, O
this O
might O
mean O
an O
incomplete O
fix O
(becuase O
of O
different O
affected O
versions O
, O
a O
split O
would O
be O
clear O
in O
such O
a O
scenario). O
but O
, O
the O
quadratic O
blowup O
represents O
larger O
questions O
about O
when O
we O
decide O
that O
algorithmic O
complexity O
is O
just O
normal O
behavior O
versus O
a O
vulnerability O
. O
clarification O
on O
resource-consumption O
dos O
when O
does O
an O
application O
cross O
the O
line O
from O
being O
"easily O
exploited O
" O
to O
"just O
going O
slowly O
because O
it's O
been O
given O
so O
much O
data"? O
this O
is O
a O
cve O
inclusion O
question O
, O
and O
there O
are O
no O
clear O
answers O
when O
it O
comes O
to O
resource O
consumption O
. O
we O
are O
almost O
certain O
to O
include O
an O
issue O
as O
a O
dos O
when O
any O
of O
the O
following O
hold O
: O
(1 O
) O
there O
is O
a O
worst-case O
complexity O
that's O
"really O
bad O
" O
compared O
to O
the O
average O
case O
(or O
at O
least O
, O
common O
usage O
) O
(2 O
) O
the O
amount O
of O
effort O
required O
by O
the O
attacker O
is O
much O
less O
than O
the O
amount O
of O
effort O
for O
the O
affected O
program O
(e.g., O
zip O
bombs O
or O
smurf/packet-storm O
attacks O
) O
(3 O
) O
un-released O
resource O
issues O
(like O
memory O
leaks O
or O
file-descriptor O
exhaustion O
) O
where O
the O
attacker O
can O
realistically O
increase O
the O
overall O
resources O
of O
the O
program O
incrementally O
, O
such O
as O
consuming O
only O
a O
small O
amount O
of O
memory O
for O
each O
"session O
" O
(4 O
) O
the O
attacker O
can O
exceed O
a O
resource-consumption O
"policy O
" O
that O
the O
software O
attempts O
to O
explicitly O
enforce O
(this O
includes O
bypassing O
quotas O
, O
or O
if O
the O
application O
doesn't O
correctly O
implement O
an O
administrator-specified O
configuration O
) O
protection O
mechanisms O
and O
"default O
configurations O
" O
in O
libraries O
the O
following O
guidance O
generally O
applies O
to O
the O
responsibilities O
of O
libraries O
versus O
applications O
in O
avoiding O
vulnerabilities O
, O
but O
we O
pay O
special O
attention O
to O
resource O
consumption O
issues O
, O
since O
that's O
the O
topic O
of O
the O
day O
. O
if O
the O
issue O
is O
an O
insecure O
"default O
configuration O
" O
in O
a O
library O
, O
please O
consult O
the O
mitre O
cna O
first O
. O
we O
do O
not O
yet O
have O
clear O
guidelines O
about O
whether O
to O
assign O
cve O
identifiers O
. O
there O
are O
still O
too O
many O
considerations O
. O
there O
are O
definitely O
some O
benefits O
to O
some O
users O
, O
especially O
software O
integrators O
, O
for O
assigning O
cves O
. O
however O
, O
there O
are O
also O
some O
complications O
; O
for O
example O
, O
some O
xml O
libraries O
have O
a O
safer O
mode O
that O
must O
be O
set O
at O
compile O
time O
. O
on O
platforms O
that O
have O
the O
"shared O
libraries O
" O
and O
"packages O
" O
concepts O
, O
this O
is O
problematic O
because O
xml-application-package-a O
has O
no O
way O
to O
force O
a O
situation O
in O
which O
xml-library-package-b O
is O
recompiled O
. O
it O
could O
instead O
inline O
the O
third-party O
library O
code O
, O
but O
that O
has O
risks O
of O
its O
own O
. O
sometimes O
the O
documentation O
suggests O
a O
source-code O
fix O
and O
there O
is O
no O
compilation O
option O
. O
certainly O
it's O
too O
burdensome O
for O
the O
application O
code O
to O
examine O
the O
library O
code O
at O
run O
time O
to O
try O
to O
figure O
out O
what O
compilation O
options O
were O
used O
. O
in O
cases O
like O
this O
, O
where O
there O
is O
little O
recourse O
to O
the O
application O
developer O
to O
diagnose O
and O
fix O
the O
issue O
, O
we O
are O
likely O
to O
assign O
a O
cve O
. O
even O
if O
the O
xml O
library O
is O
configurable O
at O
run O
time O
, O
platforms O
with O
packages O
won't O
necessarily O
be O
able O
to O
handle O
this O
well O
. O
you O
can't O
have O
n O
applications O
that O
want O
to O
have O
independent O
control O
of O
the O
configuration O
file O
of O
one O
library O
. O
finally O
, O
applications O
typically O
have O
to O
work O
with O
multiple O
versions O
of O
a O
library O
, O
especially O
multiple O
popular O
versions O
, O
so O
it O
might O
be O
reasonable O
to O
ask O
an O
application O
to O
take O
on O
some O
responsibility O
. O
so O
for O
now O
, O
we O
will O
treat O
these O
on O
a O
case-by-case O
basis O
. O
(requiring O
system-wide O
configuration O
, O
although O
it O
apparently O
is O
effectively O
for O
use O
by O
a O
single O
user); O
cve-2010-2085 O
and O
cve-2010-1459 O
(which O
are O
effectively O
for O
a O
framework O
, O
not O
a O
library O
, O
but O
we O
don't O
have O
application-specified O
cves O
; O
and O
cve-2005-1992 O
(which O
is O
a O
"defualt O
configuration O
" O
in O
a O
programming O
language O
library). O
for O
now O
, O
if O
there O
is O
a O
"default O
configuration O
" O
or O
compiler-configured O
security O
setting O
in O
a O
library O
, O
please O
consult O
the O
mitre O
cna O
. O
if O
a O
library O
does O
not O
have O
a O
built-in O
mechanism O
for O
input O
that O
can O
reasonably O
be O
expected O
to O
be O
untrusted O
, O
then O
it O
can O
be O
generically O
abused O
and O
the O
programmer O
has O
no O
easy O
way O
of O
working O
around O
it O
. O
so O
, O
the O
library O
should O
get O
a O
single O
cve O
. O
for O
example O
, O
an O
xml O
library O
should O
be O
expected O
to O
operate O
on O
an O
untrusted O
xml O
file O
. O
by O
contrast O
, O
the O
glibc O
malloc O
implementation O
can't O
be O
considered O
responsible O
for O
detecting O
abusive O
arguments O
(allocation O
of O
4 O
+ O
gigabytes O
of O
memory O
may O
be O
perfectly O
legitimate O
in O
some O
cases.) O
if O
a O
library O
does O
have O
a O
mechanism O
or O
"policy O
" O
for O
limiting O
resource O
consumption O
or O
other O
vulnerable O
conditions O
, O
then O
it O
does O
not O
get O
a O
cve O
(although O
a O
bypass O
of O
such O
a O
mechanism O
still O
qualifies.) O
when O
a O
protection O
mechanism O
is O
available O
, O
responsibility O
shifts O
to O
applications O
. O
an O
application O
should O
receive O
a O
cve O
if O
all O
of O
the O
following O
hold O
: O
(a O
) O
the O
library O
provides O
an O
api O
mechanism O
through O
which O
safe O
operation O
can O
be O
achieved O
, O
(b O
) O
the O
application O
does O
not O
use O
that O
mechanism O
for O
safe O
operation O
, O
and O
(c O
) O
the O
application O
does O
not O
use O
any O
other O
mechanism O
for O
safe O
operation O
(e.g., O
resource-limited O
child O
processes). O
any O
application O
that O
uses O
the O
library O
without O
(1 O
) O
using O
its O
resource-consumption O
limits O
or O
(2 O
) O
otherwise O
implementing O
its O
own O
protection O
mechanisms O
(such O
as O
spawning O
child O
processes O
with O
memory O
limits), O
should O
get O
a O
cve O
. O
this O
second O
item O
is O
important O
- O
we O
shouldn't O
"blame O
" O
an O
application O
just O
because O
it O
uses O
its O
own O
protection O

instead O
of O
the O
library's O
mechanism O
. O
we O
know O
this O
means O
that O
a O
large O
number O
of O
applications O
can O
be O
"blamed O
" O
and O
will O
receive O
a O
cve O
. O
but O
, O
no O
library O
can O
be O
reasonably O
expected O
to O
make O
universal O
decisions O
on O
resource O
limits O
for O
all O
of O
its O
potential O
users O
- O
that O
would O
hurt O
usability O
. O
we O
hope O
that O
this O
post O
is O

and O

cve's O

continues O
to O

. O

subject: O
re: O
cve-2020-16092 O
qemu: B-PRO
reachable O
assertion O
failure O
is O
it O
really O
worth O
the O
effort O
to O
treat O
these O
things O
as O
security O
issues O
? O
there O
are O
so O
many O
ways O
to O
crash O
a O
machine O
(be O
it O
virtual O
or O
hardware), O
there O
are O
definitely O
countless O
ways O
to O
crash O
things O
from O
within O
privileged O
code.. O
what's O
the O
security O
impact O
of O
a O
hardware O
issue O
when O
, O
say O
, O
a O
driver O
code O
in O
the O
os O
does O
a O
stupid O
thing O
and O
the O
hardware O
locks O
up O
? O
i O
see O
your O
point O
. O
our O
general O
assumption O
is O
to O
*not O
* O
consider O
assert() O
failures O
cve O
worthy O
if O
they O
can O
only O
be O
triggered O
by O
privileged O
users O
[1]. O
in O
this O
case O
specifically O
, O
given O
the O
assertion O
failure O
occurs O
while O
sending O
packets O
from O
the O
guest O

we O
assumed O
it O
may O

possible O
for O
an O
unprivileged O
guest O
user O
to O
cause O
a O
dos O
scenario O
(e.g., O
by O
sending O
malicious/malformed O
network O
packets). O
in O
accordance O
with O
qemu B-PRO
maintainers O
, O
we O
therefore O
decided O
to O
provide O
a O
fix O
for O
this O
bug O
. O
but O
again O
, O
i O
agree O
these O
kinds O
of O
issues O
tend O
to O
be O
questionable O
, O
so O
we O
typically O
proceed O
on O
a O
case-by-case O
basis O
. O

hat O
product O

leak I-VUL
via O

vulnerability O
was O

in O

manager O
that O
may O
expose O
the O
master O
password O
when O
changed O

passed O
on O
the O
commandline O
. O

changed O
. O

password O
changed O

will O
show O
"passwd O

subject: O
re: O
cve-2017-7592: O
libtiff: B-PRO
left O
shift O
wrote O
: O
this O
is O
a O
bug O
, O
but O
how O
is O
it O
a O
security O
vulnerability O
? O
can O
an O
attacker O
exploit O
it O
for O
dos O
or O
code O
execution O
or O
something O
with O
a O
malformed O
tiff O
image O
? O
quesitons O
like O
this O
come O
up O
quite O
often O
. O
maybe O
we O
need O
a O
final O
definite O
answer O
to O
them O
all O
:-) O
the O
reasoning O
is O
roughly O
: O
it's O
undefined O
behavior O
, O
so O
the O
compiler O
can O
do O
whatever O
it O
wants O
. O
so O
all O
undefined O
behavior O
should O
be O
considered O
security O
relevant O
, O
because O
the O
compiler O
can O
always O
do O
something O
that O
will O
turn O
it O
into O
a O
vuln O
. O
whether O
you O
agree O
to O
this O
or O
not O
, O
it's O
definitely O
good O
secure O
coding O
practice O
to O
avoid O
undefined O
behavior O
. O
people O
have O
different O
ideas O
of O
what O
to O
call O
a O
vuln O
and O
what O
not O
. O
cve-assigners O
have O
lately O
taken O
a O
very O
wide O
approach O
of O
declaring O
many O
things O
as O
cve-worthy O
. O
just O
accept O
that O
not O
every O
cve O
means O
"it's O
definitely O
exploitable". O

( O

subject: O
rpcbomb: B-PRO
remote O
rpcbind B-PRO
denial-of-service O
this O
vulnerability O
allows O
an O
attacker O
to O
allocate O
any O
amount O
of O
bytes O
(up O
to O
4 O
gigabytes O
per O
attack O
) O
on O
a O
remote O
rpcbind B-PRO
host O
, O
and O
the O
memory O
is O
never O
freed O
unless O
the O
process O
crashes O
or O
the O
administrator O
halts O
or O
restarts O
the O
rpcbind B-PRO
service O
. O
attacking O
a O
system O
is O
trivial O
; O
a O
single O
attack O
consists O
of O
sending O
a O
specially O
crafted O
payload O
of O
around O
60 O
bytes O
through O
a O
udp O
socket O
. O
this O
can O
slow O
down O
the O
systems O
operations O
significantly O
or O
prevent O
other O
services O
(such O
as O
a O
web O
server O
) O
from O
spawning O
processes O
entirely O
. O
an O
extensive O
write-up O
can O
be O
found O
here O
: O
https://guidovranken.wordpress.com/2017/05/03/rpcbomb-remote-rpcbind-denial-of-service-patches O
/ O
exploit O
+ O
patches O
: O
https://github.com/guidovranken/rpcbomb O
/ O

subject: O

hi O

subject: O
re: O
rpcbomb: B-PRO
remote O

denial-of-service O
from O
: O

arnold O
, O

vranken O
wrote O
: O

vulnerability O
allows O

of O

is O
never O

process O
crashes O
or O

or O

service O
. O
[...] O

extensive O
write-up O
can O
be O

: O
https://guidovranken.wordpress.com/2017/05/03/rpcbomb-remote-rpcbind-denial-of-service-patches O

: O

subject: O
cve O
request: O
jenkins B-PRO
remote O
code O
execution O
vulnerability O
an O
unauthenticated O
remote O
code O
execution O
vulnerability O
was O
discovered O
in O
the O
jenkins B-PRO
continuous O
integration O
and O
continuous O
delivery O
automation O
server O
. O
a O
serialized O
java O
object O
transferred O
to O
the O
jenkins B-PRO
cli O
can O
make O
jenkins B-PRO
connect O
to O
an O
attacker-controlled O
ldap O
server O
, O
which O
in O
turn O
can O
send O
a O
serialized O
payload O
leading O
to O
code O
execution O
, O
bypassing O
existing O
protection O
mechanisms O
. O
the O
jenkins B-PRO
project O
tracks O
this O
as O
security-360 O
. O
releases O
with O
the O
fix O
are O
planned O
for O
wednesday O
, O
november O
16 O
. O
please O
assign O
a O
cve O
to O
this O
issue O
. O
jenkins B-PRO
website O
: O
https://jenkins.io O
/ O
publication O
of O
the O
vulnerability O
in O
this O
talk O
: O
https://www.deepsec.net/speaker.html#pslot250 O

and O
workaround O
by O

jenkins B-PRO
project O

https://groups.google.com/d/msg/jenkinsci-advisories/-fc-w9tneje/grvezwojbgaj O

subject: O
moving O
in O
the O
wrong O

[was: O

- O
cve-2015-3456] O
on O
wed O
, O

, O

at O

, O

that O

about O

and O

would O

. O

" O

once O

subject: O
cve O
request: O
cabextract B-PRO
-- O
directory B-VUL
traversal I-VUL
cabextract B-PRO
is O
susceptible O
to O
a O
directory B-VUL
traversal I-VUL
vulnerability O
. O
while O
extracting O
files O
from O
an O
archive O
, O
it O
removes O
leading O
slashes O
from O
filenames O
but O
does O
it O
before O
possibly O
decoding O
utf-8 O
and O
doesn't O
check O
for O
invalid O
hence O
an O
absolute O
filename O
can O
be O
shoved O
through O
by O
using O
overlong O
encoding O
for O
the O
leading O
slash O
(and O
setting O
utf8 O
attribute O
in O
the O
header). O
this O
can O
be O
exploited O
by O
a O
malicious O
archive O
to O
write O
files O
outside O
the O
current O
directory O
. O
cannot O
access O
/tmp/abs O
: O
no O
such O
file O
or O
directory O
$ O
./cabextract O
test.cab O
extracting O
cabinet O
: O
test.cab O
extracting O
/tmp O
in O
the O
sed O
command O
above O
, O
\xe0\x80\xaf O
is O
an O
overlong O
encoding O
for O
'/', O
xa0\x00 O
are O
flags O
updated O
to O
include O
utf-8 O
flag O
. O
the O
issue O
was O
found O
in O
cabextract B-PRO
1.4 B-VER
and O
2-byte O
encoding O
(\xc0\xaf O
) O
was O
enough O
to O
hide O
'/'. O
cabextract B-PRO
1.5 B-VER
tightened O
utf-8 O
checks O
and O
3-byte O
encoding O
is O
now O
necessary O
. O
the O
issue O
was O
reported O
to O
stuart O
caie O
today O
and O
fixed O
in O
less O
than O
4h O
: O
http://sourceforge.net/p/libmspack/code/217 O
/ O
another O
release O
of O
cabextract B-PRO
is O
expected O
in O
the O
next O
few O
days O
. O

to O

of O
.desktop O

, O

was O

by O

to O

bit O
. O

, O

permission O
bit O
is O
maintained O
when O

inside O
a O

, O
for O
example O

if O

wraps O

.desktop O

(for O

of O

.desktop O

. O

can't O

any O

with O

in O

-c O
'/usr/share/applications/minimal.desktop O

: O
/usr/share/applications/minimal.desktop O
: O
permission O
denied O
conclusions O
(1 O
) O
file O
(and O
directory O
) O
ownership O
and O
permissions O
control O
what O
can O
be O
executed O
. O
not O
whether O

appears O
in O
a O

or O

somewhere O

of O

and O

to O
be O
working O
to O
prevent O

execution O
. O

is O

to O

(incorrect O

is O

of O

works O
. O

following O

that O
is O

is O

. O

of O

is O

. O

expected O

commit O

, O
but O
(cf O
. O
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1287623#c6 O

cve-2015-3210 O
was O
assigned O
for O

issue O
fixed O
by O
the O
same O
revision O
r1558 O
. O
we O

plan O
to O
keep O

and O

. O

try O

answer O

question O

ways O

1 O

methodologies O
discovered O

can O

ids O
, O
even O
if O

is O
the O

. O

methodology O

that O

by O
a O

for O
"fix O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
for O
named O
recursive O
back O
reference O
. O
" O
our O
experience O
is O
that O
red O
hat O
generally O
has O
a O
good O
process O
for O
locating O
commits O
based O
on O
the O
associated O
bug O
reports O
; O
however O
, O
we O
sometimes O
don't O
know O
how O
they O
reach O
a O
specific O
conclusion O
. O
the O
pattern O
in O
question O
for O
cve-2015-3210 O
, O
i.e., O
the O
^(?p=b)((?p O
= O
b)))>wgxcredits)/ O
pattern O

have O
any O
instances O
of O
something O
like O
\1 O
or O

are O

for O

subject: O
cve-2016-8630 O
kernel: O
kvm: O

null O
pointer B-VUL
dereference I-VUL
duringinstruction O
from O
: O
p O
j O
p O
<ppandit@...hat.com O
to O
: O
oss O
security O
list O
<oss-security@... O
osh@...gle.com O
decode O
hello O
, O
linux B-PRO
kernel I-PRO
built O
with O
the O
kernel-based O
virtual O
machine O
(config_kvm O
) O
support O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
a O
null O
pointer B-VUL
dereference I-VUL
flaw O
. O
it O
could O
occur O
on O
x86 O
platform O
, O
when O
emulating O
an O
undefined O
instruction O
. O
a O
user/process O
could O
use O
this O
flaw O
to O
crash O
the O
host O
kernel O
resulting O
in O
dos O
. O
upstream O
patch O
: O
-> O
https://git.kernel.org/linus/d9092f52d7e61dd1557f2db2400ddb430e85937e O
reference O

request: O

certificates O
when O
loading O
https O
page O

. O

to O

the O
security O
exception O
for O
a O
single O
session O
(not O
check O
off O

this O

restart O

of O

this O
to O
be O
a O

flaw O
=> O
no O

bts O
entry O
. O

times O
close\r\n\r\n O
' O
| O
nc O
localhost O
80 O
provided O
that O
the O
filename O
actually O
exists O
, O
munin B-PRO
will O
render O
the O
image O
========== O
means O
exactly O
, O
does O
the O
file O
vmstat-day.png O
need O
to O
exist O
where O
? O
it O
seems O
like O
if O
the O
image O
is O
of O
any O
size O
(say O
20k O
or O
more O
) O
the O
amplification O
(each O
get O
request O
= O
20k O
of O
tmp O
space O
usage O
) O
and O
the O
files O
have O
to O
be O
deleted O
manually O
it O
might O
qualify O
as O
a O
dos O
. O
helmut@... O
divi.de O
can O
you O
shed O
more O
light O
on O
this O
? O
the O
basic O
requirement O
is O
that O
a O
plugin O
called O
vmstat O
is O
configured O
for O
the O
node O
localhost.localdomain O
. O
i O
just O
picked O
it O
as O
an O
example O
, O
cause O
it O
is O
present O
on O
my O
system O
. O
in O
practise O
any O
plugin O
for O
any O
host O
will O
do O
. O
the O
filling O
of O
the O
disk O
works O
by O
choosing O
a O
unique O
query O
string O
for O
each O
request O
, O
because O
munin B-PRO
"caches O
" O
all O
theses O
images O
without O
ever O
deleting O
them O
and O
includes O
the O
query O
string O
in O
the O
filename O
. O
so O
you O
are O
right O
, O
that O
we O
get O
a O
base O
amplification O
of O
20k/request O
. O
in O
addition O
munin B-PRO
parses O
parts O
of O
the O
query O
string O
. O
you O
are O
allowed O
to O
modify O
the O
size O
of O
the O
image O
. O
by O
choosing O
a O
path O
"....png?size_x=20000&size_y=20000&uniquestuff O
" O
you O
can O
do O
the O
same O
attack O
while O
simultaneously O
using O
a O
large O
image O
size O
. O
the O
raw O
image O
would O
be O
381m O
(assuming O
8bits/pixel O
) O
in O
this O
case O
. O
a O
png O
version O
will O
likely O
be O
smaller O
, O
say O
4m O
? O
so O
now O
you O
have O
an O
amplification O
of O
4m/request O
. O
note O
that O
this O
query O
can O
get O
a O
node O
into O
swapping O
, O
because O
rrdtool O
needs O
to O
create O
the O
whole O
image O
in O
main O
memory O
. O
hope O
this O
helps O
helmut O

. O

was O

written O
beyond O
its O

. O

buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
can O

a O
kernel O

. O

only O

field O

passwords O
for O

based O
authentication O
hi O
list O
, O
aria2 B-PRO
is O
a O
lightweight O
multi-protocol O
command-line O
utility O
which O
leaks O
data O
or O
potential O
password O
via O
`--log=` O
attribute O
for O
http O
based O
authentication O

might O
allow O
local O
attackers O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
. O
this O
issue O
is O
somewhat O
similar O
to O
(2019/01/01/1). O

was O
observed O
that O
url's O
which O
gets O
downloaded O
via O
`--log=` O
attribute O
stores O
sensitive O
information O
. O

to O

. O

much O

number O
of O

to O
deal O
with O
. O

to O

. O

find O
out O
about O

. O

of O
the O
problem O
here O
. O

are O

flaws O
, O
and O

, O
and O

all O

vendors O

may O
not O
find O
out O
about O
them O
. O
we O
do O
monitor O
quite O
a O
few O
sources O
but O
the O
open O
source O
world O
is O
rather O
massive O
and O
the O
number O
of O
commits O
daily O
is O
on O
the O
large O
side O
. O
this O
is O
why O
for O
example O
i've O
been O
trying O
to O
make O
cve's O
easily O
available O
so O
people O
are O
more O
likely O
to O
come O
to O
us O
with O
borderline O
issues O
("i'm O
not O
sure O
but O
this O
looks O
weird O
and O
may O
be O
security O
related"). O
i'm O
also O
working O
on O
a O
set O
of O
examples O
for O
the O
cve O
howto O
so O
again O
developers O
will O
hopefully O
be O
able O
to O
realize O
when O
things O
look O
weird O
and O
may O
be O
a O
security O
issue O
and O
not O
just O
a O
flaw O
. O
i'm O
trying O
to O
find O
ways O
to O
help O
educate O
people/make O
it O
easier O
for O
them O
to O
report O
security O
issues O
but O
this O
is O
a O
non O
trivial O
problem O
. O
we O
also O
are O
willing O
to O
help O
people O
coordinate O

(this O
is O
quite O
often O
a O
more O
difficult O
task O
than O
it O
should O

again O
to O

chances O
of O

being O

and O
people O

. O
i O
think O

here O

. O

subject: O
assignment O
of O
cve O
ids O
with O
5 O
or O
more O
digits O
by O
january O
13, O
2015 O
alan.coopersmith@...cle.com O
, O
gremlin@...mlin.ru O
, O
cve@...re.org O
based O
on O
recent O
discussion O
on O
oss-security O
and O
general O
interest O
, O
i O
thought O
it O
was O
important O
to O
clarify O
what O
is O
currently O
planned O
for O
issuing O
5-digit O
cve O
ids O
by O
the O
dealine O
of O
january O
13 O
, O
2015 O
. O
currently O
, O
cve-2014-9509 O
is O
our O
last O
allocated O
id O
from O
2014 O
. O
during O
2015 O
, O
we O
will O
continue O
to O
issue O
cve-2014-xxxx O
ids O
for O
other O
issues O
that O
were O
disclosed O
in O
2014 O
, O
but O
it O
is O
highly O
unlikely O
that O
we O
will O
cross O
the O
5-digit O
threshold O
by O
january O
13 O
. O
we O
will O
still O
issue O
at O
least O
one O
valid O
5-digit O
cve-2014-xxxxx O
id O
, O
and O
probably O
more O
, O
on O
january O
13 O
. O
this O
is O
a O
one-time O
exception O
to O
our O
usual O
sequential O
allocation O
process O
. O
we O
are O
doing O
this O
as O
a O
final O
"test O
" O
to O
ensure O
that O
cve-using O
implementations O
can O
handle O
the O
syntax O
change O
. O
we O
might O
also O
issue O
cve O
ids O
with O
more O
than O
5 O
digits O
, O
since O
it O
is O
highly O
likely O
that O
some O
implementations O
will O
make O
a O
5-digit O
assumption O
, O
even O
though O
an O
arbitrary O
number O
of O
digits O
is O
allowed O
by O
the O
syntax O
change O
, O
which O
went O
into O
effect O
more O
than O
a O
year O
ago O
. O

is O

look O

subject: O

wrote O
: O
an O
integer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
, O
leading O
to O
heap-based O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
flaw O
was O
found O
in O
the O
way O
libsndfile B-PRO
, O
library O
for O
reading O
and O
writing O
of O
sound O
files O
, O
processed O
certain O

(paf O

in O

, O
linked O
against O
libsndfile B-PRO
, O
could O
lead O
to O
that O
particular O
application O
crash O
(denial O
of O
service), O
i O
agree O
with O
everything O
up O
to O
here O
. O
or O
, O
potentially O
arbitrary O
code O
execution O
with O
the O
privileges O
of O
the O
user O
running O
the O
application O
. O
but O
this O
is O
rubbish O
. O
the O
heap O
gets O
overwritten O
with O
zeros O
which O
would O
certainly O
lead O
to O
the O
application O
segfaulting B-VUL
. O
however O
, O
there O
is O
no O
way O
for O
arbitrary O
code O
to O
be O
executed O
on O
amy O
sane O
os O
with O
proper O
memory O
protection O
. O
thank O
you O
for O
the O
clarification O
regarding O
this O
. O
to O
be O
honest O
didn't O
have O
chance O

for O
this O
issue O
yet O
, O

was O

only O
on O
information O

those O

and O

. O

a O
victim O
that O
way O
? O
though O
that O
is O
not O
exactly O
automatic O
, O
most O
browsers O
show O
a O
prompt O
asking O
what O
to O
do O
with O
a O
downloaded O
file O
. O
a O
whole O
ago O
, O
there O
was O
a O
vuln O
in O
evince O
in O
how O
it O
handled O
comic O
book O
files O
. O
by O
default O
, O
nautilus O
renders O
a O
thumbnail O
of O
media O
if O
it O
is O
possible O
, O
and O
evince O
can O
render O
a O
thumbnail O
of O
the O
first O
image O
in O
the O
comic O
book O
simply O
by O
browsing O
to O
the O
downloads O
directory O
. O
if O
a O
malicious O
comic O
book O
were O
downloaded O
but O
not O
opened O
, O
then O
i O
opened O
my O

, O
rendering O
the O
comic O
book O
thumbnail O
would O
cause O
the O
payload O
to O
be O
executed O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
user O
opening O
nautilus O
. O
this O
same O
technique O
would O
apply O
here O
since O
nautilus O
can O
use O
ghostscript B-PRO
to O
render O
a O
thumbnail O
preview O
of O
a O
ps O
file O
. O
so O
, O
still O
slightly O
confused O
, O
how O
one O
can O
become O
a O
victim O
here O
just O
browsing O
a O
website O
. O
it's O
probably O
obvious O
to O
everyone O
but O
i'm O
not O
getting O
it O
having O
always O
run O
a O
quite O
minimal O
desktop O
for O
years O
(currently O
a O
mixture O
of O
awesome O
window O
manager O
+ O

elements O

subject: O

cve O
id O
request: O
openttd B-PRO
0.6.1 B-VER
and I-VER
below I-VER
are O
susceptible O
to O
a O
remotely O
exploitable O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
when O
the O
server O
is O
filled O
with O
companies O
and O
clients O
with O
names O
that O
are O
(near O
) O
the O
maximum O
allowed O
length O
for O
names O
. O
in O
the O
worst O
case O

will O
write O
the O
following O
(mostly O
remotely O
changable O
bytes O
) O
into O
1460 O
bytes O
of O
malloc-ed O
memory O
: O
up O
to O
11 O
times O
(amount O
of O
players O
) O
118 O
bytes O
up O
to O
8 O
times O
(amount O
of O
companies O
) O
124 O
bytes O
and O
7 O
"header O
" O
bytes O
resulting O
in O
up O
to O
2297 O
bytes O
being O
written O
in O
1460 O
bytes O
of O
malloc-ed O
memory O
. O
this O
makes O
it O
possible O
to O
remotely O
crash O
the O
game O
or O
change O
the O
gamestate O
into O
an O

state O
. O

subject: O
rule O
for O

for O

this O
question O

so O
here O
we O
go O
: O
when O
should O
vendors O
publish O
fixes O
for O
bugs O
that O
are O
under O
embargo O
? O
my O
opinion O
is O
that O
the O
point O
of O
security O
embargoes O
, O
and O
linux-distro O
in O
particular O
, O
is O
to O
give O
vendors O
time O
to O
prepare O
a O
fix O
so O
that O
fixes O
can O
be O
released O
almost O
immediately O
after O
the O
issue O
is O
made O
public O
. O
releasing O
a O
fix O
early O
pretty O
much O
leaks O
the O
issue O
to O
people O
monitoring O
distro O
updates O
, O
especially O
if O
there O
is O
a O
clear O
changelog O
that O
states O
there O
have O
been O
security O
fixes O
with O
a O
neat O
summary O
and O
sources O
are O
available O
. O
i'm O
asking O
because O
this O
happened O
today O
and O
some O
vendor O
released O
a O
kernel O
with O
patches O
for O
cve-2018-3690 O
(yet O
another O
speculation/side-channel O
vulnerability), O
but O
their O
fix O
for O
it O
broke O
another O
component O
in O
the O
kernel O
(rdma O
networking O
) O
and O
people O
trying O
to O
fix O
that O
bug O
are O
now O
wasting O
their's O
and O
everyone's O
my O
time O
saying O
they O
cannot O
make O
the O
rdma O
issue O
public O
because O
it O
has O
been O
caused O
by O
a O
security O
fix O
still O
under O
embargo O
. O
at O
this O
point O
, O
i'm O
not O
sure O
what O
this O
is O
supposed O
to O
protect O
: O
i O
have O
a O
pretty O
good O
idea O
of O
what O
the O
fixes O
are O
about O
and O
i'm O
not O
a O
security O
researcher O
, O
so O
if O
i O
could O
figure O
this O
much O
i'm O
sure O
smarter O
people O
can O
use O
it O
, O
and O
folks O
who O
are O
waiting O
for O
the O

to O
end O
before O
actually O

(including O
upstream!) O

now O

in O

. O
i O
don't O
really O
care O
about O
speculation/side O
channel O
attacks O
frankly O
but O

no O
reason O
other O

subject: O
re: O
freenas B-PRO
default O
blank O
password O
begin O
pgp O
signed O
message O
hash O
: O
sha1 O
my O
understanding O
is O
default/blank O
admin O
credentials O
now O
== O
there O
isn't O
a O
precise O
rule O
of O
this O
type O
. O
for O
example O
, O
there O
may O
be O
situations O
in O
which O
the O
blank O
credentials O
can O
only O
be O
entered O
over O
a O
trusted O
interface O
(for O
some O
definition O
of O
"trusted O
" O
that O
is O
consistent O
with O
the O
vendor's O
security O
policy O
and O
otherwise O
reasonable O
for O
the O
product's O
context). O
so O
an O
attacker O
can O
easily O
race O
the O
admin O
to O
the O
webgui O
, O
set O
a O
new O
password O
similarly O
, O
"race O
the O
admin O
to O
the O
webgui O
" O
situations O
don't O
always O
qualify O
for O
cve O
ids O
. O
there O
are O
many O
products O
in O
which O
the O
full O
functionality O
of O
install.php O
is O
available O
to O
the O
first O
client O
who O
visits O
install.php O
. O
a O
product O
can O
have O
a O
design O
constraint O
that O
installation O
must O
not O
require O
the O
person O
to O
have O
any O
ability O
to O
use O
a O
command O
line O
(or O
other O
non-browser O
method O
) O
for O
any O
part O
of O
the O
initial O
product O
setup O
. O
this O
design O
constraint O
was O
historically O
reasonable O
for O
some O
types O
of O
shared O
web O
hosting O
, O
for O
example O
. O
for O
this O
freenas B-PRO
case O
, O
the O
blank O
password O
seems O
unreasonable O
because O
-- O
the O

for O
a O
reboot O
implies O
that O
the O
product O
is O
not O
intended O
for O
use O
in O
constrained O
scenarios O
such O
as O
shared O
web O
hosting O
-- O
the O
web O
interface O
exposes O
a O
root O
shell O
. O
this O
is O
quite O
different O
from O
a O

where O
use O
of O

has O
a O
consequence O
limited O
to O
"the O
machine O
ends O

and O

still O

subject O
: O
re O
: O
linux B-PRO
kernel I-PRO
signal O
spoofing O
vulnerability O
(cve O
on O
03/23/2011 O
06:56 O
am O
, O
julien O
tinnes O
wrote O
: O
the O
libc B-VULPART
' O
sigqueue() B-VULPART
function O
allows O
to O
queue O
a O
signal O
, O
as O
well O
as O
some O
accompanying O
data O
to O
a O
process O
. O
the O
kernel's B-PRO
interface O
that O
is O
used O
to O
implement O
this O
function O
is O
known O
as O
rt_sigqueueinfo(). B-VULPART
it O
has O
been O
added O
in O
linux B-PRO
2.2 B-VER
. O
this O
system O
call O
is O
interesting O
from O
a O
security O
perspective O
, O
because O
it O
allows O
userland O
to O
compeletely O
specify O
the O
siginfo_t O
structure O
. O
this O
structure O
is O
normally O
typically O
almost O
entirely O
written O
by O
the O
kernel O
when O
a O
signal O
is O
delivered O
. O
since O
at O
least O
linux B-PRO
2.4.0 O
, O
most O
abuses O
of O
the O
kernel O
interface O
have O
been O
prevented O
with O
a O
simple O
check O
: O
/* O
not O
even O
root O
can O
pretend O
to O
send O
signals O
from O
the O
kernel O
. O
nor O
can O
they O
impersonate O
a O
kill(), O
which O
adds O
source O
info O
. O
* O
if O
(info.si_code>= O
0 O
) O
return O
-eperm O
; O
this O
check O
made O
sure O
that O
rt_sigqueueinfo() B-VULPART
could O
not O
spoof O
a O
signal O
whose O
si_code O
would O
be O
si_kernel O
or O
si_user O
. O
as O
the O
comment O
indicates O
, O
a O
process O
receiving O
a O
signal O
should O
be O
able O
to O
trust O
its O
source O
pid O
or O
uid O
if O
its O
si_code O
matches O
si_user O
. O
unfortunately O
, O
a O
couple O
of O
years O
later O
, O
when O
tgkill() O
and O
tkill() O
were O
added O
, O
this O
check O
was O
forgotten O
and O
was O
not O
updated O
to O
prevent O
the O
spoofing O
of O
a O
tgkill O
si_code O
. O
because O
of O
this O
, O
userland O
is O
unable O
to O
trust O
the O
pid O
and O
uid O
information O
of O
a O
tkill O
signal O
. O
this O
is O
bad O
, O
because O
it O
is O
a O
useful O
feature O
in O
a O
scenario O
where O
a O
process O
which O
cannot O
ptrace O
you O
can O
send O
you O
signals O
. O
this O
includes O
at O
least O
the O
startup O
code O
of O
setuid O
binaries O
. O
meanwhile O
, O
userland O
and O
libc B-VULPART
writers O
still O
assumed O
that O
they O
could O
trust O
the O
origin O
of O
a O
si_tkill O
signal O
. O
glibc O
authors O
too O
[1]. O
worse O
: O
they O
even O
silently O
patched O
si_tkill O
with O
si_user O
[2], O
[3]. O
so O
even O

application O
that O
(righfully O
so O
) O
only O
trusts O

signals O
will O

. O

' O

( O
(si_code O

a O
local O
system O
as O
it O
requires O
scsi O
disk O
to O
be O
present O
, O
root O
privileges O
or O
rawio O
caps O
, O
but O
this O
can O
be O
quickly O
turned O
into O
a O
meaningful O
attack O
if O
a O
scsi O
disk O
is O
passed O
through O
to O
a O
virtual O
machine O
. O
an O
attacker O
can O
issue O
absolutely O
legit O
scsi O
read/write O
commands O
to O
a O
disk O
in O
his O
vm O
, O
that O
will O
make O
vm's O
memory O
pages O
used O
for O
io O
to O
be O
extra O
refcounted O
. O
then O
attacker O
can O
power O
down O
a O
vm O
and O
the O
memory O
will O
be O
definitely O
lost O
. O
few O
exploit O
runs O
with O
power O
cycles O
in O
between O
, O
and O
the O
whole O
host O
can O
get O
oom O
. O
a O
proposed O
patch O
: O
https://www.mail-archive.com/linux-kernel@vger.kernel.org/msg1495884.html O
the O
patch O
for O
this O
flaw O
is O
not O
in O
the O
linux B-PRO

upstream O
at O
the O

. O

================ O

is O

of O

) O

2.6 I-VER
versions I-VER
(windows O
and O

versions O
) O

both O
the O
script-fu B-VULPART
console I-VULPART
and O

script-fu I-VULPART

server I-VULPART
. O
a O

to O
the O

treat O
"behavior O
that O

" O

an O

could O
have O

a O

still O

with O
the O

. O

imperialviolet O
disclosure O
says O
: O
"tls's O
padding O
is O
a O
subset O
of O
sslv3's O

could O
use O

and O

but O

. O

: O

4 O
, O
2016 O
protocol O
handling O
issues O
in O
x O
window O
system O
client O
libraries O
============================================================ O
description O
tobias O
stoeckmann O
from O
the O
openbsd O
project O
has O
discovered O
a O
number O
of O
issues O
in O
the O
way O
various O
x B-PRO
client I-PRO
libraries I-PRO
handle O
the O
responses O
they O
receive O
from O
servers O
, O
and O
has O
worked O
with O
x.org's O
security O
team O
to O
analyze O
, O
confirm O
, O
and O
fix O
these O
issues O
. O
these O
issue O
come O
in O
addition O
to O
the O
ones O
discovered O
by O
ilja O
van O
sprundel O
in O
2013 O
. O
most O
of O
these O
issues O
stem O
from O
the O
client O
libraries O
trusting O
the O
server O
to O
send O
correct O
protocol O
data O
, O
and O
not O
verifying O
that O
the O
values O
will O
not O
overflow B-VUL
or O
cause O
other O
damage O
. O
most O
of O
the O
time O
x O
clients O
& O
servers O
are O
run O
by O
the O
same O
user O
, O
with O
the O
server O
more O
privileged O
than O
the O
clients O
, O
so O
this O
is O
not O
a O
problem O
, O
but O
there O
are O
scenarios O
in O
which O
a O
privileged O
client O
can O
be O
connected O
to O
an O
unprivileged O
server O
, O
for O
instance O
, O
connecting O
a O
setuid O
x O
client O
(such O
as O
a O
screen O
lock O
program O
) O
to O
a O
virtual O
x O
server O
(such O
as O
xvfb O
or O
xephyr O
) O
which O
the O
user O
has O
modified O
to O
return O
invalid O
data O
, O
potentially O
allowing O
the O
user O
to O
escalate O
their O
privileges O
. O
the O
x.org O
security O
team O
would O
like O
to O
take O
this O
opportunity O
to O
remind O
x O
client O
authors O
that O
current O
best O
practices O
suggest O
separating O
code O
that O
requires O
privileges O
from O
the O
gui O
, O
to O
reduce O
the O
attack O
surface O
of O
issues O
like O
this O
. O

and O

all B-PRO
in I-PRO

**affected O

in O

**cve O

**cvssv3 O
base O
score O

for O

active O

: O
2 O
+ O
million O
source O
: O
< O
https://wordpress.org/plugins/all-in-one-seo-pack O
/ O
impact O
by O
exploiting O
the O
documented O
vulnerability O
, O
an O
authenticated O
attacker O
with O
the O
ability O
to O
create O
posts O
can O
execute O
javascript O
code O
in O
a O

. O
this O
can O
be O
misused O
, O
e.g O
for O

attacks O
by O
displaying O
a O
fake O
login O
form O
and O
sending O
the O
victim's O
credentials O
to O
the O
attacker O
. O
furthermore O
malicious O
actions O
can O
be O
performed O
in O
the O
context O
of O
an O
authenticated O
user O
. O
the O
impact O
depends O
on O
the O
level O
of O
access O
of O
the O
attacked O
user O
. O
in O
case O
of O
an O
admin O
this O
can O
lead O
to O
the O
execution O
of O
php O
code O
and O
the O
compromise O
of O
the O
server O
. O
vulnerability O
description O
the O
plugin O
adds O
several O
fields O
to O
the O
page O
where O
a O
post O
can O
be O
created O
or O
edited O
. O
this O
allows O

a O

and O
description O
for O
each O
post O
. O
the O
information O
provided O
there O
, O
will O
be O
inserted O
in O
corresponding O
`meta`-tags O
on O
the O
page O
of O
the O
post O
. O
the O
values O
of O
the O
fields O
are O
escaped O
before O
they O
are O
inserted O
into O
the O
html O
of O
the O
page O
. O
however O
, O
in O
the O

field O
, O
there O
is O
the O
possibility O
to O
insert O
placeholders O
that O
get O
replaced O
with O
certain O
values O
before O
output O
. O
a O
placeholders O
can O
be O
also O
set O
for O
the O
previously O
mentioned O
title O
field O
. O
the O
relevant O
code O
can O
be O
found O
in O
`aioseop_class.php B-VULPART
` I-VULPART
lines O
4546-4548 O
: O
```php O
if O
( O
false O
!= O
{ O

= O
str_replace O
( O
'%post_title%', O
$this->get_aioseop_title O
( O
$post O

), O

); O
} O
``` O
when O
an O
attacker O
sets O
a O

field O
and O
provides O
a O

for O

of O

field O
in O

field O
, O

of O

get O
inserted O
in O

. O

of O
concept O

desc:%description%` O

is O

will O

html O
page O
will O
contain O
the O
following O
code O
(shortened O
for O

```html O
[...] O
[...] O
``` O

recommend O
to O

the O
output O
by O

these O

whether O

the O

to O
each O

subject O
: O
cve-2017-11746 O
: O
tenshi B-PRO
privilege O
escalation O
via O
pid O
file O
manipulation O
andrea O
barisani O
who O
fixed O
several O
other O
issues O
and O
got O
a O
new O
release O
out O
to O
help O
fix O
this O
one O
. O
== O
summary O
== O
the O
tenshi B-PRO
daemon O
should O
create O
its O
pid O
file O
before O
dropping O
privileges O
. O
this O
represents O
a O
minor O
security O
issue O
; O
additional O
factors O
are O
needed O
to O
make O
it O
exploitable O
. O
== O
details O
== O
the O
purpose O
of O
the O
pid O
file O
is O
to O
hold O
the O
pid O
of O
the O
running O
daemon O
, O
so O
that O
later O
it O
can O
be O
stopped O
, O
restarted O
, O
or O
otherwise O
signalled O
(many O
daemons O
reload O
their O
configurations O
in O
response O
to O
a O
sighup). O
to O
fulfil O
that O
purpose O
, O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
pid O
file O
need O
to O
be O
trustworthy O
. O
if O
the O
pid O
file O
is O
writable O
by O
a O
non-root O
user O
, O
then O
he O
can O
replace O
its O
contents O
with O
the O
pid O
of O
a O
root O
process O
. O
afterwards O
, O
any O
attempt O
to O
signal O
the O
pid O
contained O
in O
the O
pid O
file O
will O
instead O
signal O
a O
root O
process O
chosen O
by O
the O
non-root O
user O
(a O
vulnerability). O
this O
is O
commonly O
exploitable O
by O
init O
scripts O
that O
are O
run O
as O
root O
and O
which O
blindly O
trust O
the O
contents O
of O
their O
pid O
files O
. O
tenshi B-PRO
itself O
ships O
a O
few O
such O
init O
scripts O
: O
tenshi.debian-init O
, O
tenshi.suse-init O
, O
etc O
. O
== O
exploitation O
== O
an O
example O
of O
a O
problematic O
scenario O
involving O
an O
init O
script O
would O
be O
, O
1 O
. O
i O
run O
"/etc/init.d/tenshi O
start O
" O
to O
start O
the B-VULPART
daemon I-VULPART
. O
tenshi B-PRO
drops O
to O
the O
"tenshi O
" O
user O
. O
tenshi B-PRO
writes O
its O
pid O
file O
, O
now O
owned O
by O
the O
"tenshi O
" O
user O
. O
someone O
compromises O
the B-VULPART
daemon I-VULPART
, O
which O
processes O
untrusted O
input O
. O
the O
attacker O
is O
generally O
limited O
in O
what O
he O
can O
do O
because O
the B-VULPART
daemon I-VULPART
doesn't O
run O
as O
root O
. O
however O
, O
he O
can O
write O
"1 O
" O
into O
the O
pid O
file O
, O
and O
he O
does O
. O
i O
run O
"/etc/init.d/tenshi O
stop O
" O
to O
stop O
the B-VULPART
daemon I-VULPART
while O
i O
investigate O
the O
weird O
behavior O
resulting O
from O
the O
hack O
. O
the O
machine O
reboots O
, O
because O
i O
killed O
pid O
1 O
(this O
is O
normally O
restricted O
to O
root). O
== O
resolution O
== O
the O
problem O
is O
avoided O
by O
creating O
the O
pid O
file O
as O
root O
, O
before O
dropping O
privileges O
. O

facilitate O
i/o O
operations O
. O
if O
its O
size O
is O
too O
large O
, O
'cpu_physical_memory_map O
' O
could O
return O
a O
null O
address O
. O
this O
would O
result O
in O
a O
null O
dereference O
while O
un-mapping O
descriptors O
. O
add O
check O
to O
avoid O
it O
. O
use O
cve-2016-7422 O
. O
this O
is O
not O
yet O
available O
at O
http://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=history;f=hw/virtio/virtio.c O
but O

may O

for O

subject O

zimbra B-PRO

in O
aspell.php B-VULPART
, O

request O

on O
04/05/2013 O
04:21 O
am O
, O
michael O

wrote O

flaw O
in O

, O
in O

spell O
checking O
external O
webservice O
. O
since O
i O
didn't O
found O

public O
web O
interface O
for O

code O
of O

and O

, O
even O

this O
mean O
losing O
some O
information O
and O

. O
the O
issue O
is O
on O
this O
file O
: O
https://github.com/zimbra-community/zimbra-sources/blob/master/main/zimbraserver/src/php/aspell.php O
the O
problem O
is O
that O
$dictionary O
is O
coming O
from O
user O
input O
( O
from O
get O
parameters O
), O
since O
it O
is O
a O
copy O
of O
$_request O
. O
then O
if O
no O
text O
is O
given O
( O
and O
so O
$text O
is O
empty O
), O
it O
is O
printed O
back O
in O
the O
html O
form O
displayed O
without O
any O
kind O
of O
sanitization O
at O
all O
( O
line133 O
: O
https://github.com/zimbra-community/zimbra-sources/blob/master/main/zimbraserver/src/php/aspell.php#l133 O
) O
so O
a O
attacker O
could O
inject O
javascript/html O
there O
just O
by O
giving O
crafted O
link O
to O
a O
user O
, O
running O
as O
the O
domain O
of O
zimbra B-PRO
( O
albeit O
on O
a O
different O
port O
). O
something O
like O
http://example.org/aspell.php?disctionnary O
= O
><script O
> O
alert('foo');</script O
( O
with O
proper O
url O
encoding O
of O
course O
). O
due O
to O
typecasting O
, O
"" O
is O
considered O
as O
equal O
to O
null O
for O
'==', O
while O
it O
may O
not O
be O
the O
case O
in O
other O
circumstances O
. O
if O
i O
am O
not O
wrong O
, O
the O
default O
location O
for O
the O
spell O
checking O
service O
is O
http://$config{hostname}:7780/aspell.php O
, O
so O
a O
improperly O
secured O
server O
( O
ie O
, O
without O
a O
firewall O
) O
could O
be O
vulnerable O
to O
javascript O
injection B-VUL
, O
which O
could O
be O
used O
to O
steal O
various O
informations O
( O

nielsen O
wrote O
: O
shouldn't O
this O
be O
in O
connect O
acl O
? O
how O
would O
the O
deny O
in O
mail O
from O
prevent O
the O
exploit O
? O
what O
i O
have O
understand O
is O
that O
there O
is O
exploit O
in O
the O
sni O
of O
the O
tls O
negotiation O
, O
thus O
the O
whole O
connect O
attempt O
must O
be O
rejected O
right O
? O
the O
connect O
acl O
won't O
protect O
you O
against O
starttls O
usage O
, O
which O
is O
far O
more O
common O
for O
email O
than O

. O
i O
myself O
use O
the O
helo O
acl O
. O
blocking O
in O
the O
mail O
acl O
is O
safe O
. O
the O
problem O
is O
not O
in O
the O
tls O
sni O
itself O
. O
the O
problem O
relates O
to O
safely O

the O
sni O
in O
spool O
files O
for O
messages O
and O
what O
happens O
when O

reads O
those O
values O
back O
later O
. O
unless O
and O
until O
an O
email O
is O
spooled O
, O
there O
is O
no O
security O
hole O
. O
some O
time O
back O
, O
the O
tls O
sni O
would O
be O
written O
unescaped O
to O
the O
spool O
files O
. O
that O
meant O

in O

would O

metadata O
into O

...} O

escaping O

when O

spool O

unescaping O

reading O

back O
. O
i O
remember O

wistfully O
because O
i'm O
not O
fond O
of O
escaping/quoting O
and O
much O

using O

, O
but O

all O
of O

spool O
file O
handling O
, O
so O
just O
used O
the O

functions O
we O
had O
. O

missed O

function O

everything O
which O

== O

cve O
number O
for O
this O
vulnerability O
is O
cve-2019-18934 O
== O
summary O
recent O
versions O
of O
unbound B-PRO
contain O
a O
vulnerability O
that O
can O
cause O
shell O
code O
execution O
after O
receiving O
a O
specially O
crafted O
answer O
. O
this O
issue O
can O
only O
be O

if O
unbound B-PRO
was O
compiled O
with O
`--enable-ipsecmod O
` O
support O
, O
and O
ipsecmod O
is O
enabled O
and O
used O
in O
the O
configuration O
. O
== O
affected O
products O
unbound B-PRO
1.6.4 B-VER
up I-VER
to I-VER
and I-VER
including I-VER
1.9.4 I-VER
. O
== O
description O
due O
to O
unsanitized O
characters O
passed O
to O
the O
ipsecmod-hook O

of O

are O
met O
: O

was O

`--enable-ipsecmod O

subject O
: O
[ocert-2014-002 O
] O
xalan-java B-PRO
insufficient O
secure O
processing O
insufficient O
secure O
processing O
description O
: O
the O
xalan-java B-PRO
library O
is O
a O
popular O
xslt O
processor O
from O
the O
apache O
software O
foundation O
. O
the O
library O
implements O
the O
java O
api O
for O
xml O
processing O
(jaxp O
) O
which O
supports O
a O
secure O
processing O
feature O
for O
interpretive O
and O
xslct O
processors O
. O
the O
intent O
of O
this O
feature O
is O
to O
limit O
xslt/xml O
processing O
behaviours O
to O
"make O
the O
xslt O
processor O
behave O
in O
a O
secure O
fashion". O
it O
has O
been O
discovered O
that O
the O
secure O
processing O
features O
suffers O
from O
several O
limitations O
that O
undermine O
its O
purpose O
. O
the O
enabling O
of O
the O
secure O
processing O
feature O
in O
fact O
still O
allows O
the O
following O
processing O
to O
take O
place O
: O
* O
java O
properties O
, O
bound O
to O
xslt O
1.0 B-VER
system-property(), O
are O
accessible O
. O
* O
output O
properties O
that O
allow O
to O
load O
arbitrary O
classes O
or O
resources O
are O
allowed O
(xalanj-2435). O
* O
arbitrary O
code O
can O
be O
executed O
if O
the O
bean O
scripting O
framework O
(bsf O
) O
is O
in O
the O
classpath O
, O
as O
it O
allows O
to O
spawn O
available O
jars O
with O
secure O
processing O
disabled O
, O
effectively O
bypassing O
the O
intended O
protection O
. O
vulnerability O
report O
received O
from O
nicolas O
gregoire O
<nicolas.gregoire O
at O
agarri.fr>. O
cve O
: O
vulnerability O
report O
received O
2014-02-05 O
: O
reporter O
provides O
disclosure O
date O
set O
to O
2014-03-21 O
2014-02-06 O
: O
contacted O
apache O
security O
team O
2014-03-17 O
: O
maintainer O
provides O
patch O
for O
review O
2014-03-17 O
: O
reporter O
confirms O
patch O
2014-03-21 O
: O

cve O

. O

to O

to O

. O

iv O

impact O
: O

on O

usage O
of O
the O

hello O

bug O

. O

background O
============= O
bogofilter B-PRO
is O
a O
software O
package O
for O
classifying O
a O
message O
as O
spam O
or O
non-spam O
. O
it O
uses O
a O
data O
base O
to O
store O
words O
and O
must O
be O
trained O
which O
messages O
are O
spam O
and O
non-spam O
. O
it O
uses O
the O
probabilities O
of O
individual O
words O
for O
classifying O
the O
message O
. O
note O
that O
the O
bogofilter B-PRO
project O
is O
issuing O
security O
announcements O
only O

current O
"stable O
" O
releases O
, O
and O
not O
necessarily O
for O
past O
"stable O
" O
releases O
. O
problem O
description O
===================== O
= O
bogofilter's/bogolexer's O
base64 O
could O
overwrite O
memory O
before O
its O
heap O
buffer O
if O
the O
base64 O
input O
started O
with O
an O
equals O
sign O
, O
such O
as O
through O
misdeclaration O
of O
quoted-printable O
as O
base64 O
. O
impact O
========= O
vulnerable O
bogofilter B-PRO
and O
bogolexer O
applications O
can O
corrupt O
their O
heap O
and O
crash O
. O
the O
consequences O
are O
dependent O
on O
the O
local O
configuration O
, O
memory O
layout O
and O
operating O
system O
features O
. O
solution O
========== O
= O

your O

to O
version O
1.2.2 O
(or O
a O
newer O
release). O

is O

may_create_in_sticky() B-VULPART
performs O

returns O
either O

or O
-eacces O
. O

, O

is O
either O

oracle O
infoleak O
. O
it O
feels O

but O
then O

were O

otherwise O
. O
since O
