are O

, O
which O
is O
then O
dereferenced O
and O
further O

are O

, O
i O

just O
dos O
) O

when O

. O

: O
re O

cve-2017-7184 O
: O

: O

in O

from O
: O

designer O
<solar@...nwall.com O
i O

. O
, O
tyler O

wrote O
: O
a O
security O
issue O
was O
reported O
by O

, O
on O

chaitin O

, O
against O

linux B-PRO
kernel I-PRO
in O

. O
it O
also O
affected O
the O
upstream O
kernel O
. O
chaitin O
security O
research O
lab O
discovered O
that O

as O
called O
by O

did O
not O
verify O
that O
the O
user-specified O

was O
within O
the O
replay O
state O
buffer O
. O
this O
allowed O
for O
out-of-bounds O
reads O
and O
writes O
of O
kernel O
memory O
. O
chaitin O
security O
showed O
that O
this O
can O
lead O
to O
local O
privilege O
escalation O
by O
using O
user O
namespaces O
in O
order O
to O
configure O
xfrm O
. O

configuration O
requires O
cap_net_admin O
so O
this O
issue O
is O
mitigated O
in O
kernels O
which O
do O
not O
enable O
user O
namespaces O
by O
default O
. O
- O
https://git.kernel.org/linus/677e806da4d916052585301785d847c3b3e6186a O
- O
https://git.kernel.org/linus/f843ee6dd019bcece3e74e76ad9df0155655d0df O
red O
hat O
claims O
that O
all O
of O
rhel5 O
, O
rhel6 O
, O
and O
rhel7 O
are O

namespaces O

neither O

are O

: O
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2017-7184 O

: O

subject O
: O
re O
: O
cve O
request O
for O
attic B-PRO
: O
encrypted O
backups O
attack O
begin O
pgp O
signed O
message O
hash O
: O
sha1 O
attic B-PRO
is O
a O
deduplicating O
backup O
program O
written O
in O
python O
. O
it O
features O
encrypted O
remote O
backups O
. O
unfortunately O
: O
https://github.com/jborg/attic/issues/271 O
allow O
an O
attacker O
able O
to O
modify O
a O
remote O
encrypted O
directory O
to O
cause O
the O
client O
to O
send O
unencrypted O
data O
on O
the O
next O
backup O
run O
. O
it O
was O
fixed O
in O
this O
commit O
: O
https://github.com/jborg/attic/commit/78f9ad1faba7193ca7f0acccbc13b1ff6ebf9072 O
as O
far O
as O
we O
can O
tell O
, O
this O
means O
that O
the O
client O
determines O
whether O
to O
send O
encrypted O
or O
unencrypted O
data O
by O
asking O
the O
server O
about O
the O
value O
of O
the O
"manifest O
type O
byte O
" O
stored O
on O
the O
server O
. O
the O
reported O
security O
problem O
is O
that O
the O
client O
user O
is O
not O
asked O
to O
confirm O
that O
unencrypted O
data O
is O
acceptable O
. O
there O
are O
two O
cases O
(either O
the O
repository O
has O
never O
been O
used O
, O
or O
the O
repository O
has O
previously O
been O
used O
for O
encrypted O
data), O
but O
these O
are O
conceptually O
the O
same O
. O
use O
cve-2015-4082 O
. O
a O
separate O
question O
is O
whether O
there O
is O
any O
remaining O
vulnerability O
. O
the O
documentation O
says O
: O
https://github.com/jborg/attic/blob/master/docs/faq.rst O
when O
backing O
up O
to O
remote O
servers O
, O
is O
data O
encrypted O
before O
leaving O
the O
local O
machine O
, O
or O
do O
i O
have O
to O
trust O
that O
the O
remote O
server O
isn't O
malicious O
? O
yes O
, O
everything O
is O
encrypted O
before O
leaving O
the O
local O
machine O
. O
we O
also O
know O
that O
use O
of O
remote O
servers O
for O
unencrypted O
data O
is O
intentional O
functionality O
, O
as O
long O
as O
the O
client O
user O
has O
previously O
agreed O
to O
send O
unencrypted O
data O
to O
that O
server O
. O
it O
seems O
that O
for O
this O
advertised O
functionality O
, O
normally O
, O
a O
client's O
decision O
on O
whether O
to O
encrypt O
would O
be O
specified O
in O
the O
client's O
configuration O
, O
on O
the O
client's O
command O
line O
, O
or O
in O
a O
client-side O
user O
interface O
. O
asking O
the O
server O
seems O
to O
be O
an O
unusual O
design O
decision O
. O
(conceivably O
, O
it O
is O
unusual O
enough O
to O
have O
its O
own O
cve O
, O
but O
we O
are O
not O
sure O
about O
that.) O
a O
potentially O
problematic O
case O
would O
be O
a O
user O
who O
uses O
attic B-PRO
from O
many O
client O
machines O
, O
communicating O
with O
many O
servers O
, O
and O
intentionally O
chooses O
to O
encrypt O
in O
some O
cases O
but O
not O
all O
. O
the O
user O
goes O
to O
one O
client O
machine O
and O
types O
: O
attic_passphrase="my O
secret O
passphrase O
" O
attic B-PRO
create O
storage::second O
my O
\ O
data O
but O
has O
forgotten O
that O
the O
applicable O
server O
has O
always O
been O
set O
up O
for O
unencrypted O
use O
. O
maybe O
a O
safer O
alternative O
would O
be O
for O
a O
client O
to O
always O
send O
encrypted O
data O
unless O
: O
a O
. O

option O
such O
as O
--cleartext O
is O
on O
the O
command O
line O
or O
b O
. O

client O

specifies O

and O

attic B-PRO
process O
does O
not O
have O

to O
a O
passphrase O

to O
: O

as O

user O

from O

from O

would O

opensc B-PRO
security O
advisory O
[27-aug-2008 O
] O

with O

rights O
this O
is O
an O
update O
to O

31-jul-2008 O
. O
chaskiel O
m O
grundman O
found O
a O

in O
opensc B-PRO
. O
the O

has O
been O
fixed O
in O
opensc B-PRO
0.11.6 O
. O
in O
mitre's O
cve O
dictionary O
this O
issue O
is O
filed O
under O
cve-2008-2235 O
. O
users O
will O
need O
to O
run O
"pkcs15-tool O
-t O
-u O
" O

test O

) O

) O

security O
settings O
on O
their O
card O
. O
all O
versions O
of O
opensc B-PRO
prior B-VER
to I-VER
0.11.5 I-VER
initialized O
smart O
cards O
with O
siemens B-PRO

m4 O

system O
without O
proper O
access O
right O
: O

was O
left O
to O

(all O
access O

0.11.5 B-VER
released O

was O

match O

: O

the O
issue O
does O
not O
cross O
privilege O
boundaries O
. O
the O
vendor O
is O
specifically O
announcing O
this O
as O
"this O
is O
a O
security O
vulnerability." O
(also O
, O
wiping O
private-key O
memory O
is O
a O
conventional O
behavior O
seen O
in O
many O
products O
. O
it O
is O
not O
the O
same O
as O
wiping O
any O
memory O
block O
that O
any O

may O
feel O
is O

in O
some O

however O
, O

ever O
told O

to O
delete O

from O
memory O

would O
not O
have O

would O

have O

a O

by O

. O
because O

"this O
bug O
" O

, O
a O
single O
cve O
id O
is O
assigned O
. O
however O
, O

, O

could O
be O

- O

a O

what O

subject O
: O
cve-2015-0260 O
: O
kallithea B-PRO
: O
api O
key O
of O
repository's O
creator O
exposed O
we O
have O
recently O
discovered O
a O
security O
issue O
in O
kallithea B-PRO
[0]. O
api O
key O
of O
repository's O
creator O
is O
exposed O
by O
get_repo B-VULPART
api O
method O
. O
synopsis O
== O
====== O
a O
vulnerability O
has O
been O
found O
in O
kallithea B-PRO
, O
allowing O
remote O
attacker O
to O
gain O
access O
to O
the O
repositories O
with O
privileges O
of O
another O
existing O
user O
. O
description O
=========== O
the O
get_repo B-VULPART
api O
method O
doesn't O
check O
the O
identity O
of O
the O
caller O
and O
exposes O
all O
details O
about O
the O
repository O
"followers O
" O
regardless O
of O
whether O
they O
have O
access O
to O
such O
data O
or O
not O
. O
the O
structures O
returned O
by O
this O
method O
contain O
such O
sensitive O
information O
as O
last O
login O
timestamp O
, O
ip O
addresses O
, O
authentication O
method O
details O
and O
private O
api O
access O
keys O
: O
"followers": O
[ O
{ O
"active": O
true O
, O
"admin": O
true O
, O
the O
exposed O
information O
allows O
attacker O
to O
track O
users O
and O
gain O
access O
to O
the O
repositories O
using O
their O
api O
keys O
. O
in O
the O
case O
the O
user O
also O
has O
administrator O
rights O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
for O
the O
attacker O
to O
gain O
full O
administrator O
access O
to O
the O
kallithea B-PRO
instance O
. O
workaround O
========== O
users O
are O
advised O
to O
remove O
the O
api O
controller O
to O
prevent O
potential O
attackers O
from O
accessing O
the O
api O
. O
this O
can O
be O
achieved O
by O
deleting O
or O
commenting O
out O
lines O
458-460 O
in O
kallithea/config/routing.py O
. O
an O
alternative O
to O
that O
may O
be O
blocking O
or O
limiting O
access O
to O
/_admin/api O
urls O
in O
the O
configuration O
of O
the O
webserver O
or O
a O
front-end O
reverse O
proxy O
. O
a O
patch O
to O
remove O
api O
controller O
may O
look O
like O
this O
: O
diff O
--git O
as O
m O
: O
- O
m.connect('api', O
'/api') O
#user O
journal O
rmap.connect('journal', O
'%s/journal O
' O
% O
admin_prefix O
, O
resolution O
========== O
kallithea B-PRO
project O
has O
released O
a O
patch O
fixing O
this O
issue O
by O
removing O
the O
sensitive O
information O
from O
api O
calls O
. O
it O
is O
strongly O
recommended O
that O
users O
apply O
this O
patch O
. O
the O
patch O
applies O
to O
both O
0.1 B-VER
release O
and O
the O
latest O
mercurial O
tip O
. O
unfortunately O
, O
this O
patch O
disables O
some O
api O
functionality O
where O
the O
information B-VUL
exposure I-VUL
occured O
. O
we O
will O
continue O
seeking O
a O
solution O
which O
prevents O
unauthorised O
access O
and O
at O
the O
time O
doesn't O
break O
existing O
api O
functionality O
. O
as O
soon O
as O
such O
solution O
is O
developed O
, O
we'll O
notify O
our O
users O
. O
users O
are O
also O
advised O
to O
re-set O
or O
remove O
all O
existing O
api O
keys O
from O
the O
database O
. O
for O
the O
users O

sqlite O
or O

database O
backend O

to O

to O
run O

following O

: O

users O
set O
api_key='disabled-'||random O
(); O
affected O

vt_fg O
, O
vt_bg O
. O
changing O

is O
benign O
- O
for O
valid O
values O
, O

could O
as O
well O
be O
done O
directly O
(with O
the O
proper O

invalid O
values O

unused O
. O
changing O
vt_fg O
or/and O
vt_bg O
might O
have O
some O

ill O
effects O
, O
although O
we'd O
expect O
only O
out O
of O
bound O
reads O
, O
so O

subject O
: O
cve-2019-18899 O
: O
apt-cacher-ng O
: O
opensuse O
packaging O
for O
apt-cacher-ng O
<mgerstner@...e.de O
to O
: O
oss-security@...ts.openwall.com O
runs O
the B-VULPART
daemon I-VULPART
as O
root O
instead O
of O
as O
an O
unprivileged O
user O
hi O
, O
apt-cacher-ng O
is O
a O
caching O
proxy O
for O
downloading O
packages O
from O
debian-style O
software O
repositories O
[1]. O
in O
the O
course O
of O
a O
code O
review O
of O
apt-cacher-ng O
i O
noticed O
a O
mismatch O
between O
upstream O
configuration O
and O
the O
configuration O
used O
in O
the O
opensuse O
packaging O
. O
while O
the O
upstream O
configuration O
expects O
the B-VULPART
daemon I-VULPART
to O
run O
as O
the O
apt-cacher-ng O
unprivileged O
user O
, O
the O
opensuse O
packaging O
ships O
a O
diverging O
systemd O
service O
unit O
configuration O
, O
causing O
the O
apt-cacher-ng O
daemon O
to O
be O
running O
as O
the O
root O
user O
. O
apart O
from O
a O
generally O
increased O
attack O
surface O
by O
not O
lowering O
privileges O
this O
causes O
the O
following O
security O
issue O
: O
although O
the O
opensuse O
packaging O
for O
apt-cacher-ng O
doesn't O
employ O
the O
unprivileged O
apt-cacher-ng O
user O
, O
it O
still O
creates O
it O
in O
the O
system O
. O
the O
directory O
/run/apt-cacher-ng O
is O
created O
for O
the O
apt-cacher-ng O
user O
via O
a O
systemd-tmpfiles O
configuration O
file O
from O
the O
upstream O
sources O
. O
this O
results O
in O
the O
apt-cacher-ng O
daemon O
running O
as O
root O
, O
which O
handles O
files O
in O
/run/apt-cacher-ng O
which O
is O
owned O
by O
the O
apt-cacher-ng O
user O
. O
the B-VULPART
daemon I-VULPART
correctly O
assumes O
that O
this O
directory O
is O
safe O
to O
handle O
without O
precautions O
, O
but O
this O
assumption O
is O
broken O
by O
the O
bad O
packaging O
. O
therefore O
a O
compromised O
apt-cacher-ng O
user O
account O
can O
perform O
symlink O
attacks O
in O
/run O
to O
cause O
writes O
to O
privileged O
file O
system O
locations O
by O
root O
, O
once O
the O
apt-cacher-ng O
service O
is O
(re)started O
. O
furthermore O
the O
socket O
path O
/run/apt-cacher-ng/socket O
can O
be O
replaced O
by O
an O
attacker O
owned O
socket O
, O
thereby O
allowing O
him O
to O
hijack O
privileged O
client O
connections O
to O
apt-cacher-ng O
. O
additional O
unexplored O
security O
issues O
could O
be O
possible O
. O
an O
update O
for O
the O
broken O
packaging O
will O
be O
supplied O
for O
opensuse B-PRO
leap I-PRO
15.1 B-VER
. O
furthermore O
, O
since O
there O
is O
no O
active O
maintainer O
for O

code O
. O
details O
the O
syntaxhighlight O
extension O
utilizes O
pygments O
to O
format O
source O
code O
. O
pygments O
is O
a O
python O
library O
, O
a O
copy O
is O
provided O
with O
the O
extension O
. O
in O
order O
to O
use O
pygments O
, O

extension O
invokes O
it O
using O
symfony's O
[10 O
] O
processbuilder O
[11 O
] O
component O
. O
this O
component O
performs O
escaping O
of O
command O
line O
arguments O
to O
prevent O
command B-VUL
injection I-VUL
. O
the O
used O
lexer O
is O
specified O
through O
the O
lang O
parameter O
, O
the O
formatter O
is O
always O
set O
to O
the O
htmlformatter O
. O
additional O
options O
for O
the O
lexer O
and/or O
formatter O
are O
provided O
using O
the O
-o O
command O
line O
argument O
. O
these O
options O
can O
be O
controlled O
by O
the O
parameters O
that O
are O
supported O

the O
<syntaxhighlight O
> O
tag O
. O
each O

is O

, O
the O
options O
are O
comma O
separated O
. O
it O
was O
found O
that O
no O
input B-VUL
validation I-VUL
and/or O

is O
done O
on O
the O
start O
parameter O
. O
this O

is O
used O
to O
define O
the O
first O
line O

of O
a O
code O

. O

are O

, O

will O
start O
with O

provided O
in O

parameter O
. O

should O
only O

. O

to O

of O

can O
be O
set O
to O
any O
value O
. O
$args['start']; O
} O
since O

options O
are O
comma O
separated O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
for O

to O
provide O

. O

. O
<syntaxhighlight O

" O
start='0,prestyles="&gt;&lt;script&gt;alert(document.cookie)&lt;/script&gt;' O
string O

when O

that O

subject O
: O

- O
ossec B-PRO
root B-VUL
escalation I-VUL
thu O

11 O
https://github.com/ossec/ossec-hids/releases/tag/2.8.2 O
fix O
for O
cve-2015-3222 O
which O
allows O
for O
root B-VUL
escalation I-VUL
via O
syscheck O
affected O
versions O
: O
2.7 B-VER
- I-VER
2.8.1 I-VER
beginning O
is O
ossec B-PRO
2.7 O
(d88cf1c9 O
) O
a O
feature O
was O
added O
to O
syscheck O
, O
which O
is O
the O
daemon O
that O
monitors O
file O
changes O
on O
a O
system O
, O
called O
"report_changes". O
this O
feature O
is O
only O
available O
on O
*nix O
systems O
. O
it's O
purpose O
is O
to O
help O
determine O
what O
about O
a O
file O
has O
changed O
. O
the O
logic O
to O
do O
accomplish O
this O
is O
as O
follows O
which O
can O
be O
found O
in O
src/syscheck/seechanges.c B-VULPART
: O
252 O
/ O
the O
raw O
filename O
is O
passed O
in O
as O
an O
argument O
which O
presents O
an O
attacker O
with O
the O
possibility O
to O
run O
arbitrary O
code O
. O
since O
the O
syscheck O
daemon O
runs O
as O
the O
root O
user O
so O
it O
can O
inspect O
any O
file O
on O
the O
system O
for O
changes O
, O
any O
code O
run O
using O
this O
vulnerability O
will O
also O
be O
run O
as O
the O
root O
user O
. O
an O
example O
attack O
might O
be O
creating O
a O
file O
called O
"foo-$(touch O
bar)" O
which O
should O
create O
another O
file O
"bar". O
again O
, O
this O
vulnerability O
exists O
only O
on O
*nix O
systems O
and O
is O
contingent O
on O
the O
following O
criteria O
: O
1 O
. O
a O
vulnerable O
version O
is O
in O
use O
. O
the O
ossec B-PRO
agent O
is O
configured O
to O
use O
syscheck O
to O
monitor O
the O
file O
system O
for O
changes O
. O
the O
list O
of O
directories O
monitored O
by O
syscheck O
includes O
those O
writable O
by O
underprivileged O
users O
. O
the O
"report_changes O
" O
option O
is O
enabled O
for O
any O
of O
those O
directories O
. O
the O
fix O
for O
this O
is O
to O
create O
temporary O
trusted O
file O
names O
that O
symlink O
back O
to O
the O
original O
files O
before O
calling O
system() O
and O
running O
the O
system's O
"diff O
" O
command O
. O

: O
xen B-PRO
security O
advisory O
xsa-61 O
libxl B-VULPART
partially O
sets O
up O
hvm O
passthrough O
even O
with O
disabled O
iommu O
issue O
description O
================= O
with O
hvm O
domains O
, O
libxl's O
setup O
of O
pci O
passthrough O
devices O
does O
the O
iommu O
setup O
after O
giving O
(via O
the O
device O
model O
) O
the O
guest O
access O
to O
the O
hardware O
and O
advertising O
it O
to O
the O
guest O
. O
if O
the O
iommu O
is O
disabled O
the O
overall O
setup O
fails O
, O
but O
after O
the O
device O
has O
been O
made O
available O
to O
the O
guest O
; O
subsequent O
dma O
instructions O
from O
the O
guest O
to O
the O
device O
will O
cause O
wild O
dma O
. O
impact O
= O
===== O
a O
hvm O
domain O
, O
given O
access O
to O
a O
device O
which O
bus O
mastering O
capable O
in O
the O
absence O
of O
a O
functioning O
iommu O
, O
can O
mount O
a O
privilege O
escalation O
or O
denial O
of O
service O
attack O
affecting O
the O
whole O
system O
. O
vulnerable O
systems O
== O
only O
systems O
which O
pass O
busmastering-capable O
pci O
devices O
through O
to O
untrusted O
guests O
are O
vulnerable O
. O
only O
systems O
which O
use O
libxl B-VULPART
as O
part O
of O
the O
toolstack O
are O
vulnerable O
. O
the O
major O
consumer O
of O
libxl B-VULPART
functionality O
is O
the O

toolstack O
which O
became O
the O
default O
in O
xen B-PRO
4.2 B-VER
. O
in O
addition O
to O
this O
libvirt B-VULPART
can O
optionally O
make O
use O
of O
libxl B-VULPART
. O
this O
can O
be O
queried O
with O
# O
virsh O
version O
which O
will O
report O
"xenlight O
" O
if O
libxl B-VULPART
is O
in O
use O
. O
libvirt B-VULPART
currently O
prefers O
the O
xend O
backend O
if O
xend O
is O
running O
. O
the O
xend O
and O
xapi O
toolstacks O
do O
not O
currently O
use O
libxl B-VULPART
. O
only O
xen B-PRO
versions O
4.0.x B-VER
through I-VER
4.2.x I-VER
are O

. O

domains O
can O

of O
this O

. O

which O

. O

== O
======== O

not O

to O

subject O
: O
bug O
in O
openssl's B-PRO
cve-2012-0884 O
fix O
from O
: O
solar O
designer O
<solar@...nwall.com O
ivan O
nestlerode O
this O
is O
just O
a O
heads O
up O
that O

fix O

that O
is O

only O

security O

in O

"make O

when O

cms O

http://cvs.openssl.org/chngview?cn=22537 O
or O
with O
an O
additional O
compiler O
warning O
fix O
: O
http://cvs.openssl.org/filediff?f=openssl/crypto/cms/cms_enc.c&v1=1.11&v2=1.13 O

: O

"tkeylen O
= O
0 O
" O

is O
just O
to O

is O
to O
the O
code.) O

bug O
had O
been O

in O
: O
"fix O
for O
cms/pkcs7 B-VULPART
mma I-VULPART
. O
if O

fails O

to O

http://cvs.openssl.org/chngview?cn=22251 O
and O
more O
specifically O
in O
this O
portion O
: O
http://cvs.openssl.org/filediff?f=openssl/crypto/cms/cms_enc.c&v1=1.10&v2=1.11 O
which O
introduced O
the O
tkey O
and O
tkeylen O
variables O
. O
of O
these O
, O
tkey O
is O
initialized O
to O
null O
, O
tkeylen O
is O
left O
uninitialized O
(but O
is O
only O
meant O
to O
be O
used O
when O
tkey O
is O
non-null?) O
(this O
is O
the O
opposite O
of O
the O
condition O
used O
to O
decide O
when O
to O
generate O
a O
random O
key). O
tkeylen O
happens O
to O
be O
true O
(which O
is O
likely), O
the O
following O
block O
may O
then O
potentially O
use O
both O
tkey O
(which O
is O
null O
) O
and O
tkeylen O
(uninitialized O
) O
if O

call O
to O
evp_cipher_ctx_set_key_length() O
returns O
failure O
(shouldn't O
happen O
in O
a O
bug-free O
app?) O
perhaps O
the O
program/thread O
would O
at O
least O

in O
this O

case O
. O

what O
will O
happen O
if O

happens O

in O

above O

but O

i O
tried O

the O
line O
to O
: O
if O
(tkey O
&& O
ec->keylen O
!= O
this O
simulates O
the O
tkeylen O
== O
ec->keylen O
case O
because O
tkey O
is O
left O
at O
null O
precisely O
in O

cases O
when O
tkeylen O
is O
left O
uninitialized O
. O
when O
this O
happens O

two O
tests O
: O
is O
there O
an O
impact O
, O
and O
is O
there O
a O
way O
for O
the O
attacker O
to O
trigger O
or O
exploit O
it O
? O
does O
the O
software/system O
make O
a O
specific O
security O
claim O
that O
they O
then O
fail O
to O
meet O
? O
e.g O

"we O

hi O

, O

attached O
program O

similar O

against O
a O

program O
simply O
connects O
to O

server O

waits O

to O

, O

setting O

. O

to O

server O
, O

open O
until O

is O

and O

determining O
the O
maxstartups B-VULPART
setting O
(of O
course O

may O
not O

accurate O

on O

etc O
, O

this O
is O

minor O

the O
code O
continues O
to O
sleep O
for O
logingracetime B-VULPART
seconds O
and O
spawns O
maxstartup O
connections O
again O
. O
as O
a O
result O
, O

and O

between O

. O

subject O
: O
cve-2017-15115 O
: O
linux B-PRO
kernel I-PRO
: O
sctp B-VULPART
: O
use-after-free B-VUL
in O
it O
was O
found O
that O
in O
linux B-PRO
kernel I-PRO
when O

off O
an O
association O
to O
the O
socket O
in O

, O
all O
transports O
in O
this O

are O
not O

and O
keep O
use O

old O

in O

. O

transports O
from O

when O

are O

. O
later O

a O

could O

the O
transports O
. O

subject O
: O

dos O

is O
a O
file O
handling O
dos O
in O
gimp B-PRO
(the O
gnu O
image O
manipulation O
program O
) O
for O
the O
'fit O
' O
file O
format O

all O

to I-VER

buffer B-VUL

these O
fixes O
need O
to O
be O
tagged O
to O
a O
cve O
. O
the O
cifs B-VULPART
code O
regularly O
has O
to O
convert O
strings O
from O
ucs2_le O
(a O
double O
byte O
encoding O
scheme O
used O
on O
windows O
) O
to O
the O
local O
nls O
charset O
. O
the O
routines O
that O
do O
this O
have O
a O
very O
poor O
scheme O
for O
handling O
buffer O
lengths O
. O
the O
string O
conversion O
routines O
accept O
only O
a O
single O
length O
parameter O
specified O
in O
units O
of O
the O
number O
of O
wide O
characters O
that O
it O
should O
try O
to O
convert O
. O
it's O
assumed O
therefore O
that O
the O
destination O
buffer O
will O
be O
big O
enough O
. O
some O
measures O
are O
in O
place O
now O
to O
try O
to O
ensure O
this O
, O
but O
they O
really O
aren't O
sufficient O
. O
what's O
needed O
is O
a O
new O
set O
of O
conversion O
routines O
that O
take O
both O
the O
source O
and O
destination O
buffer O
lengths O
into O
account O
. O
the O
patchset O
adds O
these O
routines O
and O
converts O
the O
appropriate O
callers O
to O
use O
them O
. O
in O
addition O
, O
it O
removes O
a O
very O
large O
piece O
of O
"experimental O
" O

code O
that O
i O
found O
to O

completely O

. O
that O
code O

release O
. O
: O

) I-VULPART

. O

. O

: O

. O

. O
: O

ignore O

. O

wrote O
: O
i've O

stack B-VUL
overflow I-VUL

. O

with O

under O
user O

all O

, O
up B-VER

current I-VER
(1.1.23 I-VER
) I-VER
release I-VER
. O
users O

, O

issue O
. O

: O

that O
was O

overview O

through B-VER

. O
**affected O

in O

**cvssv3 O

score O
** O
: O

(high O
) O
vendor O
description O

for O

on O

/ O
impact O
by O
exploiting O
the O
documented O

, O

attacker O
with O
the O

to O

posts O
can O
execute O

` I-VULPART

. O

. O
https://codex.wordpress.org/shortcode_api#html O
proof O

subject: O
re: O
rgpg B-PRO
ruby O
gem O
remote O
command B-VUL
injection I-VUL
(cve O
request) O
"a O
simple O
ruby O
wrapper O
around O
gpg O
command O
for O
file O
encryption O
. O
rgpg B-PRO
is O
a O
simple O
api O
for O
interacting O
with O
the O
gpg O
tool O
. O
it O
is O
specifically O
designed O
to O
avoid O
altering O
global O
keyring O
state O
by O
creating O
temporary O
public O
and O
secret O
keyrings O
on O

fly O
for O
encryption O
and O

the O
following O
code O
snippet O
does O
not O
sanitize O
user O
supplied O
input O
before O
passing O
it O
to O
the B-VULPART
system I-VULPART
() I-VULPART
function I-VULPART
for O
execution O
. O
if O
this O
api O

page_alloc_lock B-VULPART
and O

back O

subject: O
[security O
advisory] O
curl: B-PRO
url O
file O
scheme O
drive O
letter O
buffer O
to O
: O
curl O
security O
announcements O
-- O
curl O
users O
<curl-users@...l.haxx.se>, O
curl O
- O
oss-security@...ts.openwall.com O
overflow B-VUL
url O
file O
scheme O
drive O
letter B-VUL
buffer I-VUL
overflow I-VUL
============================================ O
project O
curl O
security O
advisory O
, O
june O
14th O
2017 O
when O
libcurl B-PRO
is O
given O
either O
1 O
. O
a O
file O
: O
url O
that O
doesn't O
use O
two O
slashes O
following O
the O
colon O
, O
or O
2 O
. O
is O
told O
that O
file O
is O
the O
default O
scheme O
to O
use O
for O
urls O
without O
scheme O
... O
and O
the O
given O
path O
starts O
with O
a O
drive O
letter O
and O
libcurl B-PRO
is O
built O
for O
windows O
or O
dos O
, O
then O
libcurl B-PRO
would O
copy O
the O
path O
with O
a O
wrong O
offset O
, O
so O
that O
the O
end O
of O
the O
given O
path O
would O
write O
beyond O
the O
malloc O
buffer O
. O
up O
to O
seven O
bytes O
too O
much O
. O
we O
are O
not O
aware O
of O
any O
exploit O
of O
this O
flaw O
. O
info O
this O
flaw O
also O
affects O
the O
curl O
command O
line O
tool O
. O
it O
was O
introduced O
in O
commit O
[1d4202ade602]( O
https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/1d4202ade602 O
), O
discussed O
in O
[issue O
#1124]( O
https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/1124 O
). O
http O
redirects O
to O
file O
: O
urls O
are O
not O
affected O
. O
for O
version O
7.54.1 O
, O
the O
function O
that O
cleans O
up O
the O
file O
: O
urls O
is O
fixed O
to O
not O
copy O
things O
out O
of O
the O
buffer O
! O
the O
common O
vulnerabilities O
and O
exposures O
(cve O
) O
project O
has O
assigned O
the O
name O
cve-2017-9502 O
to O
this O
issue O
. O
affected O
versions O
this O
bug O
is O
present O
on O
libcurl B-PRO
builds O
that O
accept O
drive O
letters O
in O
file O
names O
, O
which O
is O
limited O
to O
windows O
and O
dos O
builds O
, O
including O
cygwin O
. O
affected O
versions O
: O
libcurl B-PRO
7.53.0 O
to O
and O
including O
7.54.0 O
not O
affected O
versions O
: O
7.54.1 O
libcurl B-PRO
is O
used O
by O
many O
applications O
, O
but O
not O
always O
advertised O
as O
such O
! O
the O
solution O
the O
function O
now O
takes O
better O
care O
to O
allocate O
memory O
enough O
to O
store O
what's O
copied O
and O
to O
copy O
the O
strings O
to O
the O
correct O
output O
offsets O
. O
a O
[patch O
for O
cve-2017-9502 O
] O
recommendations O
we O
suggest O
you O
take O
one O
of O
the O
following O
actions O
immediately O
, O
in O
order O
of O
preference O
: O
a O
- O
upgrade O
curl O
and O
libcurl B-PRO
to O
version O
7.54.1 O
b O
- O
apply O
the O
patch O
to O
your O
version O
and O
rebuild O
c O
- O
do O
not O
use O
file O
urls O
on O
windows O
time O
line O
it O
was O
reported O

project O
on O

subject: O
re: O
cve O
request: O
bd-j B-PRO
implementation O
in O
libbluray B-PRO
begin O
pgp O
signed O
message O
hash O
: O
sha256 O
it O
was O
found O
that O
org.videolan.bdjloader O
class O
implementation O
of O
libbluray B-PRO
, O
a O
library O
to O
access O
blu-ray O
disks O
for O
video O
playback O
, O
was O
missing O
java O
security O
manager O
sandboxing O
. O
a O
specially-crafted O
java O
application O
, O
utilizing O
the O
functionality O
of O
org.videolan.bdjloader O
class O
, O
could O
use O
this O
missing O
feature O
to O
perform O
actions O
as O
the O
user O
running O
the O
bluray O
player O
application O
. O
libbluray B-PRO
upstream O
disables O
bd-j B-PRO
support O
by O
default O
, O
but O
some O
downstreams O
(like O
fedora O
) O
pass O
--enable-bdjava O
at O
configure O
time O
, O
enabling O
it O
for O
their O
distribution O
. O
this O
is O
a O
situation O
in O
which O
there O
may O
be O
multiple O
valid O
perspectives O
. O
what O
we're O
going O
to O
do O
is O
assign O
a O
cve O
id O
to O
the O
fedora O
package O
for O
the O
use O
of O

at O
a O
time O
when O
there O
had O
not O
been O
an O
upstream O
release O
with O
default O
support O
for O
bd-j B-PRO
. O
use O
cve-2015-7810 O
. O
the O
upstream O
default O
was O
changed O
here O
: O
default O
support O
for O
bd-j B-PRO
was O
present O
in O
0.8.0 O
(released O
2015-04-29 O
) O
but O
not O
in O
0.7.0 B-VER
(released O
2015-01-27). O
https://download.videolan.org/pub/videolan/libbluray O
/ O
doesn't O
list O
any O
releases O
between O
these O
. O
in O
0.7.0 B-VER
, O
the O
configure O
script O
has O
: O
--enable-bdjava O
enable O
bd-java O
support O
(default O
is O
no O
) O
under O
"optional O
features O
" O
but O
we O
didn't O
find O
any O
documentation O
or O
comments O
suggesting O
that O
--enable-bdjava O
was O
recommended O
for O
general O
use O
cases O
at O
that O
time O
. O
apparently O
, O
bdjsecuritymanager O
development O
came O
after O
0.7.0 B-VER
. O
in O
other O
words O
, O
our O
perspective O
is O
that O
the O
primary O
known O
mistake O
is O
that O
the O
fedora O
packaging O
process O
chose O
a O
non-standard O
default O
behavior O
, O
and O
either O
didn't O
investigate O
or O
didn't O
document O
the O
risks O
. O
if O
anyone O
else O
independently O
chose O

for O
their O
package O
based O
on O
0.7.0 B-VER
or O
earlier O
, O
then O
they O
can O
have O
their O
own O
cve O
id O
. O
on O
the O
question O
of O
whether O
cve O
ids O
can O
be O
assigned O
for O
an O
upstream O
bdjsecuritymanager O
error O
(or O
omission), O
we O
don't O
currently O
know O
. O
certainly O
if O
the O
upstream O
documentation O
announced O
that O
the O
product O
was O
intended O
for O
arbitrary O
untrusted O
blu-ray O
content O
, O
then O
any O
security-relevant O
behavior O
would O
be O
a O
vulnerability O
. O
blu-ray O
content O
is O
designed O
to O
be O
(in O
some O
senses O
, O
but O
maybe O
not O
all O
arbitrary O
senses O
) O
executable O
content O
. O
http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/02/23/12 O
suggests O
an O
original O
upstream O
goal O
of O
handling O
trusted O
content O
in O
which O
the O
java O
code O
is O
trusted O
java O
code O
. O
accordingly O
, O
it O
seems O
reasonable O
to O
interpret O
bdjsecuritymanager O
as O
a O
work O
in O
progress O
. O
the O
existence O
of O
later O
releases O
doesn't O
mean O
they O
have O
announced O
that O
they O
are O
finished O
. O
for O
the O
general O
case O
of O
attacks O
that O
use O
media O
content O
, O
the O
cve O
assignment O
process O
has O
an O
expectation O
that O
untrusted O
content O
may O
occur O
; O
however O
, O
any O
known O
upstream O
goal O
is O
always O
considered O
(also O
, O
the O
situation O
details O
are O
unusual O
here O
because O
the O
attack O
relies O
on O
java O
, O
not O
memory O
safety O
in O
handling O
audio/video O
data). O
"many O
physical O
players O
have O
settings O
to O
prevent O
discs O
from O
accessing O
the O
internet O
for O
privacy O
reasons O
. O
" O
if O
a O
device's O
documentation O
stated O
that O
the O
internet O
would O
never O
be O
accessed O
, O
and O
the O
observed O
behavior O
were O
that O
the O
internet O
is O
accessed O
, O
then O
there O
could O
be O
a O
cve O
. O
finally O
, O

do O

that O
: O
http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/02/06/9 O

subject: O
cve O
request: O

emulator: O

instructions O
to O
15 O
us.mitre.org O
bytes O

from O

patch O
: O
"while O
we O
are O

bytes O
, O

games O

will O

. O

that O

can O

subject: O
cve-2018-3665 O
lazy B-PRO
fpu O
context O
switching O
information B-VUL
leak I-VUL
affected O
software O
/ O
hardware O
: O
all O
operating O
system O
kernels O
/ O
hypervisors O
using O
lazy B-PRO
fpu O
context O
switching O
running O
on O
intel O
cpus O
(more O
details O
below O
) O
summary O
: O
the O
fpu O
register O
state O
(legacy/mmx/sse/avx/avx-512 O
registers O
) O
can O
be O
leaked O
across O
process O
or O
virtual O
machine O
boundaries O
using O
speculative O
execution O
on O
intel O
cpus O
when O
the O
hypervisor O
or O
operating O
system O
kernel O
uses O
lazy B-PRO
fpu O
context O
switching O
. O
impact O
: O
any O
information O
in O
the O
above O
registers O
is O
accessible O
to O
a O
local O
attacker O
. O
operating O
systems O
and O
hypervisor O
need O
to O
switch O
to O
eager O
fpu O
context O
switching O
or O
clear O
fpu O
register O
state O
on O
context O
switch O
. O
relying O
on O
cr0.ts O
to O
protect O
fpu O
registers O
is O
insufficient O
. O
this O
issue O
was O
reported O
to O
intel O
by O
amazon O
and O
cyberus O
technology O
. O
the O
issue O
was O
discovered O
by O
julian O
stecklina O
(jsteckli@...zon.de O
) O
and O
thomas O
prescher O
(thomas.prescher@...erus-technology.de). O
this O
issue O
was O
also O
independently O
discovered O
by O
zdenek O
sojka O
- O
sysgo O
ag O
( O
http://sysgo.com O
) O
and O
colin O
percival O
. O
detailed O
description O
==================== O
technical O
description O
lazy B-PRO
fpu O
context O
switching O
optimizes O
context O
switch O
times O
by O
lazily O
saving O
and O
restoring O
the O
content O
of O
legacy O
when O
the O
kernel O
switches O
from O
task O
a O
to O
task O
b O
, O
task O
a's O
register O
content O
stays O
in O
the O
fpu O
, O
but O
the O
fpu O
is O
disabled O
via O
cr0.ts O
. O
if O
task O
b O
touches O
the O
fpu O
, O
a O
#nm O
exception O
is O
generated O
, O
the O
kernel O
switches O
the O
register O
content O
, O
and O
enables O
the O
fpu O
agan O
. O
from O
that O
point O
task O
b O
can O
use O
the O
fpu O
. O
between O
the O
context O
switch O
to O
task O
b O
and O
the O
#nm O
exception O
that O
would O
trigger O
the O
actual O
context O
switch O
, O
the O
fpu O
registers O
contain O
task O
a's O
register O
content O
and O
the O
fpu O
is O
disabled O
. O
the O
attack O
works O
by O
speculatively O
reading O
the O
task O
a's O
fpu O
register O
contents O
from O
task O
b O
in O
this O
time O
frame O
and O
retrieving O
the O
contents O
via O
a O
cache O
side-channel O
. O
let's O
call O
task O
a O
the O
victim O
and O
task O
b O
the O
attacker O
. O
the O
attacker O
loads O
xmm0 O
with O
0 O
and O
installs O
a O
sigsegv O
handler O
. O
then O
he O
gives O
the O
victim O
(task O
a O
) O
a O
chance O
to O
run O
by O
sleeping O
. O
afterwards O
, O
the O
attacker O
flushes O
the O
cache O
line O
pointed O
to O
by O
mem O
+ O
64 O
(see O
below), O
runs O
the O
following O
code O
: O
; O
cause O
a O
page O
fault O
and O
execute O
the O
below O
code O
speculatively O
until O
the O
; O
processor O

execution O
and O
delivers O
the O
page O
fault O
. O
read O
xmm0 O
. O
this O
would O
cause O
a O
#nm O
exception O
because O
the O
fpu O
is O
disabled O
, O
but O
; O
it O
is O
never O
delivered O
, O
because O
execution O
is O
rolled O
back O
to O
the O

fault O
. O
; O
now O
mask O
a O
bit O
in O
the O

we O
read O

touch O
memory O

on O

. O

[mem O

begin O

hash O
: O

nix O
security O
advisory O
nix-2017-0003 O
2017-07-19 O
ldap O
with O
usetls O
disabled O
tls O
peer O
verification O
description O
=========== O
the O
users.ldap O
nixos B-PRO
module O
implements O
user O
authentication O
against O
ldap O
servers O
via O
a O
pam O
module O
. O
it O
was O
found O
that O
if O
tls O
is O
enabled O
to O
connect O
to O
the O
ldap O
server O
with O
users.ldap.usetls O
, O
peer O
verification O
will O
be O
unconditionally O
disabled O
in O
/etc/ldap.conf O
. O
impact O
== O
==== O
a O
man-in-the-middle O
attack O
can O
be O
performed O
by O
an O
attacker O
between O
a O
machine O
with O
enabled O
ldap O
authentication O
and O
the O
ldap O
server O
. O
even O
though O
tls O
is O
enabled O
an O
attacker O
is O
able O
to O
impersonate O
the O
ldap O
server O
with O
an O
invalid O
certificate O
. O
attackers O
might O
be O
able O
to O
steal O
user O
password O
hashes O
or O
service O
account O
credentials O
in O
plaintext O
. O
vulnerable O
systems O
================== O
16.09 O
and O
earlier O
releases O
are O
unsupported O
and O
vulnerable O
. O
distribution O
# O
nixos-rebuild O
switch O
resolution O
========== O
nixos B-PRO
now O
does O
not O
add O
"tls_checkpeer O
no O
" O
to O
the O
ldap O
configuration O
when O
users.ldap.usetls O
is O
enabled O
. O
users O
who O
need O
this O
behavior O
can O
add O
it O
back O
via O
the O
users.ldap.extraconfig O
option O
. O
begin O
pgp O
signature O
yvt O
+ O
end O
pgp O
signature O

subject: O
cve-2017-1000255: O
linux: O
powerpc: B-VULPART
kernel O
memory O
overwrite O
in O
transactional O
memory O
handling O
leitao@...ian.org O
on O
linux O
running O
on O
powerpc O
hardware O
(power8 O
or B-VER
later I-VER
) O
a O
user O
process O
can O
craft O
a O

frame O
and O
then O
do O

so O
that O

kernel O
will O
take O
an O

(interrupt), O
and O
use O
the O
r1 O
value O
from O
the O
signal O
frame O
as O
the O
kernel O
stack O
pointer O
. O
as O
part O
of O
the O
exception O
entry O
the O
content O
of O
the O
signal O
frame O
is O
written O
to O
the O
kernel O
stack O
, O

. O

("powerpc O

(tm O

was O

("powerpc/64s O

thing O
program O

. O

subject: O
stack-based O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
in O
musl B-PRO
libc I-PRO
0.8.7 B-VER
and I-VER
earlier I-VER
stack-based O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
in O
musl B-PRO
libc I-PRO
0.8.7 B-VER
and I-VER
earlier I-VER
software O
: O
vulnerability O
type O
: O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
severity O
: O
critical O
software O
description O
: O
musl B-PRO
is O
an O
implementation O
of O
the O
c/posix O
standard O
library O
for O
linux-based O
systems O
. O
musl B-PRO
aims O
to O
be O
lightweight O
, O
fast O
, O
simple O
, O
free O
, O
and O
correct O
in O
the O
sense O
of O
standards-conformance O
and O
safety O
, O
and O
to O
meet O
requirements O
ranging O
from O
embedded O
systems O
and O
initrd O
images O
to O
desktop O
workstations O
, O
mobile O
devices O
, O
and O
high-load O
servers O
. O
several O
build-from-source O
mini-distributions O
use O
musl B-PRO
as O
their O
c O
library O
. O
vulnerability O
details O
: O
musl's O
implementation O
of O
[v]fprintf O
swaps O
in O
a O
temporary O
file O
buffer O
on O
the O
stack O
when O
writing O
to O
unbuffered O
streams O
such O
as O
stderr O
. O
under O
certain O
conditions O
where O
the O
buffer O
end O
pointer O
has O
already O
been O
set O
to O
the O
address O
of O
the O
internal O
degenerate O
buffer O
prior O
to O
the O
call O
to O
[v]fprintf O
, O
stdio O
internals O
can O
fail O
to O
bound O
access O
to O
the O
temporary O
buffer O
. O
large O
writes O
will O
then O
overflow B-VUL
the O
temporary O
buffer O
and O
clobber O
stack O
contents O
, O
including O
potentially O
the O
return O
address O
. O
any O
program O
linked O
to O
musl B-PRO
which O
includes O
potentially-large O
data O
from O
untrusted O
sources O
in O
its O
output O
to O
stderr O
or O
other O
unbuffered O
streams O
is O
affected O
. O
the O
vulnerability O
has O
been O
fixed O
in O
git O
, O
and O
the O
fix O
is O
to O
be O
included O
in O
the O
upcoming O
0.8.8 O
release O
. O
a O
patch O
which O
applies O
cleanly O
to O
all O
recent O
releases O
is O
available O
on O
the O
musl B-PRO
mailing O
list O
: O
http://www.openwall.com/lists/musl/2012/04/17/1 O
credits O
: O

vulnerability O
was O

and O
fixed O
by O

subject: O
cve O
request O
for O
select() B-VULPART
buffer O
overrun O
in O
chicken B-PRO
scheme O
on O
the O
android O
platform O
i O
would O
like O
to O
request O
a O
cve O
for O
a O
select() B-VULPART
buffer O
overrun O
vulnerability O
in O
chicken B-PRO
scheme O
on O
the O
android O
platform O
. O
this O
is O
basically O
the O
same O
issue O
as O
cve-2012-6122 O
[1], O
thus O
the O
same O
workaround O
applies O
: O
set O
the O
maximum O
number O
of O
open O
files O
ulimit O
to O
a O
value O
lower O
than O
or O
equal O
to O
fd_setsize O
. O
alternatively O
, O
apply O
the O
patch O
that O
fixes O
the O
issue O
(see O
below). O
since O
the O
android O
platform O
target O
was O

fairly O
recently O
, O
the O
only O
affected O
release O
versions O
are O
4.9.0 B-VER
and O
4.9.0.1 B-VER
. O
the O
issue O
is O
fixed O
by O
switching O
to O
posix O
poll() O
on O
android O
, O
too O
. O
this O
fix O
will O
be O
included O
in O
the O
upcoming O
release O
versions O
4.9.0.2 O
, O
4.9.1 O
, O
4.10.0 O
, O
and O
5.0 O
. O
for O
the O
official O
announcement O
, O
see O
http://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/chicken-users/2014-08/msg00055.html O
the O
patch O
on O
the O
discussion O
list O
is O
http://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/chicken-hackers/2014-08/msg00017.html O
and O
it O
got O
applied O
as O
http://code.call-cc.org/cgi-bin/gitweb.cgi?p=chicken-core.git;a=commit;h=bbf5c1d5839970c17b37406155180853c325c710 O
a O
patch O
which O
changes O
the O
default O
to O
be O
posix O
poll() O
so O
that O
platforms O
added O
in O
the O
future O
will O
be O
more O
likely O
not O
to O
be O
affected O
by O
this O
issue O
is O
being O
discussed O
at O

subject: O
cve-2018-5739: O
isc O
kea B-PRO
1.4.0 B-VER
failure O
to O
release O
memory O
may O
exhaust O
system O
resources O
today O
isc O
has O
disclosed O
a O
memory B-VUL
leak I-VUL
in O
kea B-PRO
1.4.0 B-VER
that O
is O
potentially O
exploitable O
as O
a O
denial-of-service O
vector O
. O
our O
official O
disclosure O
page O
can O
be O
found O
at O
https://kb.isc.org/article/aa-01626 O
or O
the O
content O
can O
be O
found O
below O
. O
kea B-PRO
version O
1.4.0-p1 B-VER
(which O
corrects O
the O
memory B-VUL
leak I-VUL
) O
was O
publicly O
released O
today O
and O
is O
available O
from O
https://www.isc.org/downloads O
michael O
mcnally O
isc O
security O
officer O
kea B-PRO
dhcp O
1.4.0 B-VER
may O
fail O
to O
release O
memory O
after O
temporarily O
storing O
client O
network O
packets O
. O
this O
causes O
a O
constant O
increase O
in O
memory O
consumption O
that O
can O
cause O
server O
resources O
to O
become O
exhausted O
, O
leading O
to O
loss O
of O
dhcp O
server O
functionality O
. O
posting O
date O
: O
11 O
july O
2018 O
program O
impacted O
: O
kea B-PRO
dhcp O
versions O
affected O
: O
medium O
exploitable O
: O
from O
adjacent O
networks O
permitted O
to O
relay O
dhcp O
traffic O
to O
the O
kea B-PRO
server O
description O
: O
an O
extension O
to O
hooks O
capabilities O
which O
debuted O
in O
kea B-PRO
1.4.0 B-VER
introduced O
a O
memory B-VUL
leak I-VUL
for O
operators O
who O
are O
using O
certain O
hooks O
library O
facilities O
. O
in O
order O
to O
support O
multiple O
requests O
simultaneously O
, O
kea B-PRO
1.4 B-VER
added O
a O
callout O
handle O
store O
but O
unfortunately O
the O
initial O
implementation O
of O
this O
store O
does O
not O
properly O
free O
memory O
in O
every O
case O
. O
hooks O
which O
make O
use O
of O
query4 O
or O
query6 O
parameters O
in O
their O
callouts O
can O
leak O
memory O
, O
resulting O
in O
the O
eventual O
exhaustion O
of O
available O
memory O
and O
subsequent O
failure O
of O
the O
server O
process O
. O
only O
servers O
using O
hooks O
which O
make O
use O
of O
the O
callout O
handle O
store O
are O
affected O
. O
a O
kea B-PRO
server O
which O
is O
using O
one O
or O
more O
hooks O
libraries O
that O
exhibit O
this O
problem O
will O
increase O
its O
memory O
use O
over O
time O
, O
with O
the O
rate O
of O
increase O
being O
proportional O
to O
the O
amount O
of O
dhcp O
traffic O
processed O
. O
eventually O
, O
due O
to O
uncontrolled O
growth O
, O
the O
server O
will O
either O
exhaust O
all O
system O
memory O
or O
, O
if O
the O
administrator O
has O
set O
a O
per-process O
memory O
limit O
, O
will O
hit O
that O
limit O
, O
after O
which O
point O
further O
memory O
allocations O
will O
fail O
and O
the O
kea B-PRO
server O
will O
crash O
. O
an O
attacker O
who O
is O
within O
the O
broadcast O
domain O
of O
the O
kea B-PRO
server O
or O
in O
a O
network O
which O
is O
permitted O
to O
relay O
dhcp O
traffic O
to O
the O
kea B-PRO
server O
can O
hasten O
the O
arrival O
of O
this O
outcome O
by O
deliberately O
sending O
a O
large O
volume O
of O
requests O
to O
the O
kea B-PRO
server O
. O
ability O
to O
deliberately O
trigger O
this O
vulnerability O
depends O
on O
the O
hooks O
libraries O
used O
and O
the O
hook O
points O
used O
for O
callouts O
. O
our O
scoring O
for O
this O
vulnerability O
is O
based O
on O
the O
hook O
points O
used O
for O
hook O
libraries O
distributed O
by O
isc O
and O
also O
based O
on O
the O
assumption O
that O
the O
kea B-PRO
server O
does O
not O
accept O
arbitrary O
traffic O
from O
the O
internet O
(but O
is O
protected O
, O
e.g O
. O
by O
firewall O
, O
and O
only O
accepts O
dhcp O
traffic O
from O
the O
local O
broadcast O
domain O
and O
from O
nearby O
networks O
via O
authorized O
dhcp O
relay O
agents.) O
we O
cannot O
score O
every O
combination O
, O
but O
the O
risk O
could O
be O
higher O
to O
custom-developed O
hook O
libraries O
using O
other O
hook O
points O
or O
to O
servers O
which O
accept O
arbitrary O
dhcp O
traffic O
without O
restriction O
. O
if O
a O
supervising O
process O
will O
restart O
the O
kea B-PRO
server O
if O
it O
terminates O
. O
n O

on O

score O

here O

a O

attack O
vector O
hello O
, O
sarg B-PRO
[1 O
] O

. O

. O

, O

, O
cve-2015-7519 O
was O

to O
this O
issue O
. O
issue O
1 O
. O
given O

that O

protocol O

(in O

, O

foobar-user O
: O
user O
2 O
. O
it O

for O

remote O
client O
to O
set O

"colliding O
" O
header O
: O

colliding O
header O

different O

the O
server O
(_ O

. O

key O
: O
http_foobar_user O
: O
user O
http_foobar_user O
: O
impersonation O
the O
exploit O
is O
then O
that O
the O
value O
"impersonation O
" O
of O
the O
second O

may O

can O
have O

e.g O
. O
if O

header O
is O

for O
authentication O
. O
affected O

from O
32 O
to O
64-bits O
before O
being O
passed O
to O
the O
memmove O
function O
. O
this O
leads O
arguments O
between O
2gib O
and O
4gib O
to O
be O
interpreted O
as O
larger O
than O
they O
are O
(specifically O
, O
a O
bit O
below O
2^64), O
causing O
a O
buffer B-VUL
overflow I-VUL
. O
arguments O
between O
4gib O
and O
6gib O
are O
interpreted O
as O
4gib O
smaller O
than O
they O
should O
be O
, O
causing O
a O
possible O
information B-VUL
leak I-VUL
. O
this O
commit O
fixes O
the O
bug O
: O
https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/659615c7b100a89eafe6253e7a5b9d84d0e8df74#diff-a97df53e3ebc59bb457191b496c90762 O
the O
function O
caml_bit_string B-VULPART
is O
called O
indirectly O
from O
such O
functions O
as O
string.copy O
. O

for O
instance O
is O
supposed O
to O
be O

"safe O
" O
function O
for O
which O

guarantees O
apply O

. O
(we O
consider O

"to O

" O

subject: O

- O

- O

guarding O
thu O
, O
3 O
following O

is O
being O

disclosed O
today O
: O
a O

has O
been O
found O
in O
pacemaker B-PRO
, O
a O

package O
for O

. O

was O

that O
at O

, O
some O

could O
be O
talked O
to O
, O
via O

clients O

to O
flawed O

decision O
. O

on O

of O
affected O

this O
might O
equip O

user O
with O

or O

of O
possibly O

. O

intended O

is O
now O

(along O
with O
the O
unintended O
one), O
a O

to O
address O

corner O

systemically O
at O

is O
coming O
along O
( O

). O

be O

to O
the O
following O
two O
issues O
please O
? O
nathaniel O
mccallum O
of O
red O

that O

was O
using O
python's O
random O
module O
in O

of O

to O

mccallum O
of O

packet O

in O

. O

for O

subject: O
shellinabox B-PRO
- O
dns O
rebinding O
attack O
due O
to O
http O
fallback O
stephen O
roettger O
from O
the O
google O
security O
team O
reported O
to O
us O
that O
the O
shellinabox B-PRO
package O
allows O
http O
fallback O
, O
even O
when O
configured O
for O
https O
, O
via O
the O
"/plain O
" O
url O
. O
this O
fallback O
is O
quite O
easy O
to O
be O
overlooked O
and O
it O
gives O
the O
opportunity O
for O
a O
dns O
rebinding O
attacks O
against O
systems O
that O
use O
the O
service O
and O
have O
default O
credentials O
for O
a O
certain O
time O
window O
. O
i've O
opened O
an O
issue O
on O
what O
appears O
to O
be O
the O
only O
maintained O
fork O
of O
shellinabox B-PRO
at O
this O
time O
: O
https://github.com/shellinabox/shellinabox/issues/355 O
also O
we O
removed O
the O
package O
from O
the O
debian O
image O
that O
we O
publish O
for O
the O
usb O
armory O
project O
( O
http://dev.inversepath.com/download/usbarmory O
/ O
), O
here's O
the O
relevant O
changelog O
entry O
: O
security O
fix O
: O
removed O
shellinabox B-PRO
package O
the O
shellinabox B-PRO
web O
server O
was O
originally O
added O
to O
ease O
connection O
on O
hosts O
that O
do O
not O
have O
an O
ssh O
client O
. O
the O
server O
, O
while O
using O
the O
https O
protocol O
, O
allows O
http O
fallback O
through O
the O
"/plain O
" O
url O
. O
this O
exposes O
the O
opportunity O
for O
a O
potential O
dns O
rebinding O
attack O
, O
by O
malicious O
javascript O
loaded O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
user O
browser O
, O
that O
would O
allow O
connection O
to O
shellinabox B-PRO
in O
the O
time O
window O
between O
server O
startup O
and O
user O
reconfiguration O
of O
default O
credentials O
. O
while O
the O
opportunity O
for O
a O
successful O
attack O
is O
quite O
limited O
, O
it O
is O
nonetheless O
present O
. O
for O
this O
reason O
the O
shellinabox B-PRO
package O
is O
removed O
. O
cheers O
andrea O
barisani O
inverse O
path O
srl O
chief O
security O
engineer O

subject: O
re: O

subject: O
cve O
request O
- O
kernel: B-PRO
infoleak O
if O
print-fatal-signals=1 O
description O
from O
the O
upstream O
patch O
: O
when O
print-fatal-signals O
is O
enabled O
it's O
possible O
to O
dump O
any O
memory O
reachable O
by O
the O
kernel O
to O
the O
log O
by O
simply O
jumping O
to O
that O
address O
from O
user O
space O
. O
or O
crash O
the O
system O
if O
there's O
some O
hardware O
with O
read O
side O
effects O
. O
the O
fatal O
signals O
handler O
will O
dump O
16 O
bytes O
at O
the O
execution O
address O
, O
which O
is O
fully O
controlled O
by O
ring O
3 O
. O
in O
addition O
when O
something O
jumps O
to O
an O
unmapped O
address O
there O
will O
be O
up O
to O
16 O
additional O
useless O
page O
faults O
, O
which O
might O
be O
potentially O
slow O
(and O
at O
least O
is O
not O
very O
efficient O
) O
fortunately O
this O
option O
is O
off O
by O
default O
and O
only O
there O
on O
i386 O
. O
but O
fix O
it O
by O
hecking O
for O
kernel O
addresses O
and O
also O
stopping O
when O
there's O
a O
page O
fault O
. O
thanks O
, O
eugene O
eugene O
teo O
/ O
red O
hat O
security O
response O
team O

iv O
reuse O
impact O
: O
depends O
on O
the O
usage O
of O
the O
library O
hello O
, O
an O
iv O
reuse O
bug O
was O
discovered O
in O
ruby's O
openssl B-PRO
library O
when O
using O
aes-gcm B-VULPART
. O
when O
encrypting O
data O
with O
aes-*-gcm B-VULPART
, O
if O
the O
iv O
is O
set O
before O
setting O
the O
key O
, O
the O
cipher O
will O
default O
to O
using O
a O
static O
iv O
. O
this O
creates O
a O
static O
nonce O
and O
since O
aes-gcm B-VULPART
is O
a O
stream O
cipher O
, O
this O
can O
lead O
to O
known O
cryptographic O
issues O
. O
the O
documentation O
does O
not O
appear O
to O
specify O
the O
order O
of O
operations O
when O
setting O
the O
key O
and O
iv O
[1]. O
as O
an O
example O
, O
see O
the O
following O
insecure O
code O
snippet O
below O
: O
vulnerable O
code O
: O
def O
cipher O
= O
cipher.random_iv O
# O
notice O
here O
the O
iv O
is O
set O
before O
the O
key O
cipher.key O
= O
a O
developer O
that O
uses O
the O
code O
above O
may O
incorrectly O
assume O
that O
their O
code O
is O
secure O
from O
the O
pitfalls O
associated O
with O
iv O
reuse O
in O
aes-*-gcm B-VULPART
, O
since O
the O
cipher.random_iv O
method O
is O
used O
. O
according O
to O
the O
documentation O
, O
this O
should O
generate O
a O
random O
iv O
each O
time O
the O
encryption O
method O
is O
called O
. O
when O
the O
code O
above O
is O
run O
with O
the O
same O
key O
and O
same O
plaintext O
message O
, O
the O
following O
results O
are O
obtained O
: O
output O
: O
# O
run O
1 O
./gcm_encrypt.rb O
this O
is O
some O
secret O
message.' O
this O
is O
some O
secret O
message.' O
[+] O
ciphermessage O
(iv O
| O
tag O
| O
ciphertext): O
431d70714f5e5f876d1c7830 O
| O
8c676db7551cf046266252ee776ecaa9 O
| O
81092d16b62902d9985656253891dc O
800a5bb48fb1c4ad0b7bdf6054 O
notice O
that O
in O
the O
output O
above O
a O
unique O
iv O
is O
returned O
for O
both O
runs O
, O
but O
with O
the O
same O
ciphertext O
. O
this O
proves O
that O
even O
though O
the O
random_iv O
method O
is O
called O
, O
the O
code O
is O
defaulting O
to O
a O
static O
iv O
. O
if O
an O
attacker O
can O
retrieve O
multiple O
ciphertext O
messages O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
decrypt O
the O
ciphertexts O
by O
applying O
the O
same O
attack O
one O
would O
use O
in O
a O

pad O
(xor O
ciphertexts O
and O
crib O
drag). O
next O
review O
the O
following O
code O
snippet O
and O
output O
, O
which O
depicts O
a O
secure O
implementation O
of O
the O
code O
: O
valid O
code O
: O
def O

) O
cipher O
= O
iv O
= O
cipher.random_iv O
# O
notice O

is O
set O
after O
the O
key O
cipher.auth_data O
= O
"" O
ciphertext O
= O

) O
this O
is O
some O
secret O
message.' O
this O
is O
some O
secret O
message.' O

] O

via O
"sudo O
-k". O
a O
user O
who O
has O
sudo B-PRO
access O
and O
is O
able O
to O
control O
the O
local O
clock O
(common O
in O
desktop O
environments O
) O
can O
run O
a O
command O
via O
sudo B-PRO
without O
authenticating O
as O
long O
as O
they O
have O
previously O
authenticated O
themselves O
at O
least O
once O
by O
running O
"sudo O
-k O
" O
and O
then O
setting O
the O
clock O
to O
the O
epoch O
(1970-01-01 O
01:00:00). O
the O
vulnerability O
does O
not O
permit O
a O
user O
to O
run O
commands O
other O
than O
those O
allowed O
by O
the O
sudoers O
policy O
. O
by O
default O
, O
sudo B-PRO
displays O
a O
lecture O
when O
the O
user's O
time O
stamp O
file O
is O
not O
present O
. O
in O
sudo B-PRO
1.6 B-VER
, O
the O
-k O
option O
was O
changed O
to O
reset O
the O
time O
stamp O
file O
to O
the O
epoch O
rather O
than O
remove O
it O
to O
prevent O
the O
lecture O
from O
being O
displayed O
the O
next O
time O
sudo B-PRO
was O
run O
. O
no O
special O
case O
was O
added O
for O
handling O
a O
time O
stamp O
file O
set O
to O
the O
epoch O
since O
the O
clock O
should O
never O
legitimately O
be O
set O
to O
that O
value O
. O
however O
, O
there O
are O
two O
common O
ways O
for O
the O
clock O
to O
be O
reset O
to O
the O
epoch O
. O
the O
first O
way O
is O
when O
the O
clock O
is O
reset O
due O
to O
a O
fully O
drained O
battery O
on O
some O
systems O
. O
the O
other O
way O
is O
by O
a O
user O
logged O
in O
to O
a O
desktop O
environment O
that O
allows O
changes O
to O
the O
date O
and O
time O
. O
as O
long O
as O
the O
user O
has O
successfully O
run O
sudo B-PRO
before O
, O
they O
are O
able O
to O
run O
"sudo O
-k O
" O
to O
reset O
the O
time O
stamp O
file O
. O
this O
action O
does O
not O
require O
a O
password O
and O
is O
not O
logged O
. O
if O
the O
user O
is O
also O
able O
to O
reset O
the O
date O
and O
time O
to O
the O
epoch O
(1970-01-01 O
01:00:00), O
they O
will O
be O
able O
to O
run O
sudo B-PRO
without O
having O
to O
authenticate O
. O
the O
flaw O
may O
allow O
someone O
with O
physical O
access O
to O
a O
machine O
that O
is O
not O
password-protected O
to O
run O
sudo B-PRO
commands O
without O
knowing O
the O
logged O
in O
user's O
password O
. O
on O
systems O
where O
sudo B-PRO
is O
the O
principal O
way O
of O
running O
commands O
as O
root O
, O
such O
as O
on O
ubuntu O
and O
mac O
os O
x O
, O
there O
is O
a O
greater O
chance O
that O
the O
logged O
in O
user O
has O
run O
sudo B-PRO
before O
and O
thus O
that O
an O
attack O
would O
succeed O
. O
the O
bug O
is O
fixed O
in O
sudo B-PRO
1.8.6p7 O
and O
1.7.10p7 O
. O
these O
versions O
will O
ignore O
a O
time O
stamp O
file O
that O
is O
set O
to O
the O
epoch O
. O
workaround O
: O
using O
"sudo O
-k O
" O
instead O
of O
"sudo O
-k O
" O
will O
completely O
remove O
the O
time O
stamp O
file O
instead O
of O
just O
resetting O
it O
. O

and O

. O
as O

, O

: O

/ O
i O
agree O
with O
this O
part O
: O
"hierarchy O
of O
what O
kernel O
to O
use O
, O
from O

solution O
to O

: O
* O
supported O
kernel O
from O
your O

/ O
===== O
unrestricted O
entity O
expansion O
can O
lead O
to O
a O

vulnerability O
in O

. O

cve O

be O

to O

. O
details O

can O

of O

will O

like O

: O
document O
= O

method O
is O
called O
, O

will O

. O

to O

for O

. O

subject: O
[ocert-2008-004] O

2008/04/17 O
#2008-004 O

speex B-PRO

boundary O
checks O
description O
: O
the B-VULPART
reference I-VULPART
speex I-VULPART

from O

packages O
include O
similar O
code O
and O
are O
therefore O
vulnerable O
. O
in O
order O
to O
prevent O
the O
usage O
of O
incorrect O
header O
processing O
reference O
code O
, O
the O
speex_packet_to_header() B-VULPART
function O
has O
been O
modified O
to O
bound O
the O
returned O
mode O
values O
in O
speex B-PRO
>= O
1.2beta3.2 B-VER
. O
this O
change O
automatically O
fixes O
applications O
that O
use O
the O
speex B-PRO
library O
dynamically O
. O
sweep B-PRO
>= O
see O
ocert-2008-002 O
, O

subject: O
re: O
cve-request: O
typo3 B-PRO
extbase O
missing O
access O
check O
begin O
pgp O
signed O
message O
hash O
: O
sha256 O
https://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-core/typo3-core-sa-2016-013 O
/ O
typo3-core-sa-2016-013 O
extbase O
request O
handling O
fails O
to O
implement O
a O
proper O
access O
check O
for O
requested O
controller O
/ O
action O
combinations O
, O
which O
makes O
it O
possible O
for O
an O
attacker O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
extbase O
actions O
by O
crafting O
a O
special O
request O
. O
to O
successfully O
exploit O
this O
vulnerability O
, O
an O
attacker O
must O
have O
access O
to O
at O
least O
one O
extbase O
plugin O
or O
module O
action O
in O
a O
typo3 B-PRO
installation O
. O
the O
missing O
access O
check O
inevitably O
leads O
to O
information O
disclosure O
or O
remote O
code O
execution O
, O
depending O
on O
the O
action O
that O
an O
attacker O
is O
able O
to O
execute O
. O
typo3 B-PRO
installations O
with O
at O
least O
one O
publicly O
available O
extbase O
action O
, O
are O
exploitable O
without O
any O
further O
authentication O
. O
typo3 B-PRO
installations O
without O
publicly O
available O
extbase O
actions O
, O
are O
still O
exploitable O
for O
authenticated O
backend O
users O
with O
access O
to O
a O
backend O
module O
, O
which O
is O
based O
on O
extbase O
. O
use O
cve-2016-5091 O
for O
both O
of O
these O
installation O
scenarios O
. O
as O
far O
as O
we O
can O
tell O
, O
the O
second O
scenario O
("without O
publicly O
available") O
occurs O
only O
because O
typo3 B-PRO
core O
code O
(or O
a O
copy O
of O
typo3 B-PRO
core O
code O
) O
exists O
in O
, O
or O
is O
reachable O
by O
, O
a O
(supported O
or O
unsupported O
) O
backend O
module O
. O
-- O
cve O
assignment O
team O

m300 O
, O
202 O
burlington O
road O
, O

subject: O
openvz B-PRO
simfs B-PRO
container O
filesystem O
breakout O
an O
attacker O
is O
able O
to O
access O
files O
outside O
of O
his O
container O
. O
function O
open_by_handle_at() B-VULPART
enables O
process O
to O
access O
files O
on O
a O
mounted O
filesystem O
using O
file_handle B-VULPART
structure O
. O
this O
structure O
is O
using O
inode O
numbers O
to O
differentiate O
files O
. O
calling O
this O
function O
requires O
cap_dac_read_search O
capability O
and O
superuser O
inside O
a O
container O
by O
default O
has O
this O
capability O
. O
this O
enables O
an O
attacker O
to O
bypass O

restrictions O
and O
access O
all O
files O
on O
an O

on O

. O

works O

and O

scripts O
in O

subject: O
xawtv: B-PRO
cve-2020-13696: O
v4l-conf B-VULPART
setuid-root I-VULPART
program I-VULPART
allows O
file O
thu O
, O
4 O
oss-security@...ts.openwall.com O
existence O
tests O
and O
open(..., O
o_rdrw O
) O
on O
arbitrary O
files O
hallo O
, O
xawtv B-PRO
[1 O
] O
contains O
a O
setuid-root O
program O
called O
`v4l-conf O
` O
that O
is O
supposed O
to O
allow O
regular O
users O
to O
configure O
v4l O
devices O
. O
xawtv B-PRO
is O
pretty O
old O
code O
but O
it O
is O
stilled O
shipped O
on O
some O
distributions O
like O
debian O
and O
opensuse O
. O
vulnerability O
description O
========================= O
while O
checking O
the O
source O
code O
of O
`v4l-conf O
` O
i O
noticed O
that O
it O
allows O
regular O
users O
to O
perform O
arbitrary O
file O
existence O
tests O
and O
also O
to O
perform O
`open(..., O
o_rdwr)` O
and O
`fstat()` O
system O
calls O
on O
arbitrary O
files O
. O
the O
issue O
is O
found O
in O
the O
`dev_open()` O
function O
which O
only O
contains O
a O
naive O
security O
check O
: O
``` O
if O
(strncmp(device O
, O
"/dev/", O
5)) O
{ O
fprintf(stderr O
, O
"error O
: O
%s O
is O
not O
a O
/dev O
file\n", O
device); O
exit(1); O
} O
``` O
this O
check O
is O
not O
safe O
against O
relative O
path O
components O
or O
symlinks O
in O
dev/shm O
. O
example O
: O
``` O
in O
this O
case O
the O
file O
does O
not O
exist O
user O
$ O
v4l-conf O
-c O
/dev O
/ O
no O
such O
file O
or O
directory O
in O
this O
case O
the O
file O
exists O
user O
$ O
v4l-conf O
-c O
/dev O
/ O
wrong O
device O
``` O
some O
devices O
in O
/dev O
might O
also O
trigger O
code O
paths O
upon O
open() B-VULPART
in O
the O
kernel O
that O
are O
usually O
not O
reachable O
to O
regular O
users O
. O
bugfix O
====== O
upstream O
added O
two O
fixes O
in O
their O
git O
repository O
[2]: O
commit O
31f31f9cbaee7be806cba38e0ff5431bd44b20a3 O
commit O
36dc44e68e5886339b4a0fbe3f404fb1a4fd2292 O
the O
fix O
is O
still O
incomplete O
though O
. O
it O
avoids O
to O
perform O
an O
`open() O
` O
on O
unintended O
files O
. O
but O
it O
still O
allows O
the O
file O
existence O
test O
to O
be O
performed O
. O
attached O
is O
a O
small O
patch O
that O
fixes O
also O
that O
. O

patch O

of O

for O

since O

irssi B-PRO
core O

recommended O

use O
to O
retain O
your O
window O
content O
, O
many O

could O
potentially O
be O
affected O
by O
this O

restores O
the O
scrollbuffer O
between O

writing O
the O

of O
(private O

leak O

other O

files O

of O
service O
from O

transitions O

of O

',password O

request] O
local O
privilege O
escalation O
in O
libfep B-PRO
it O
was O
discovered O
that O
libfep B-PRO
uses O
unix O
domain O
sockets O
in O
the O
abstract O
namespace O
in O
an O
insecure O
way O
. O
as O
a O
result O
, O
unprivileged O
local O
users O
were O
able O
to O
inject O
commands O
into O
running O
fep O
sessions O
of O
other O
users O
. O
the O
upstream O
fix O
simply O
removes O
abstract O
namespace O
support O
, O
using O
a O
restricted O
directory O
to O
host O
the O
unix O
domain O
socket O
instead O
: O
https://github.com/ueno/libfep/commit/293d9d3f O
abstract O
namespace O
support O
was O
introduced O
in O
this O
commit O
: O
https://github.com/ueno/libfep/commit/5a170323 O
this O
means O
that O
versions O
from O
0.0.5 B-VER
to I-VER
0.0.9 I-VER
(inclusive O
) O
are O
vulnerable O
, O
and O
0.1.0 O
has O
the O
fix O
. O
florian O
weimer O
/ O
red O
hat O
product O
security O
team O

subject: O
re: O
cve-2014-8166 O
cups: O
code O
execution O
via O
unescape O
ansi O
escape O
sequences O
kurt O
seifried O
: O
so O
this O
one O
is O
pretty O
hard O
to O
cause O
exploitation O
without O
heavy O
social O
engineering/etc O
. O
it O
was O
reported O
that O
ansi O
escape O
sequences O
could O
be O
added O
to O
printer O
names O
in O
cups B-PRO
. O
becaue O
cups B-PRO
has O
a O
browsing O
feature O
that O
, O
when O
enabled O
, O
allows O
remote O
hosts O
to O
announce O
shared O
printers O
, O
a O
malicious O
host O
or O
user O
could O
send O
a O
specially-crafted O
udp O
packet O
to O
a O
cups B-PRO
server O
announcing O
an O
arbitrary O
printer O
name O
that O
includes O
ansi O
escape O
sequences O
. O
since O
the O
cups B-PRO
daemon O
does O
not O
remove O
these O
characters O
, O
a O
user O
on O
the O
targeted O
system O
could O
query O
the O
printer O
list O
(using O
'lpstat O
-a', O
for O
example). O
if O
this O
were O
done O
in O
a O
terminal O
that O
supported O
the O
ansi O
escape O
sequences O
(like O
a O
terminal O
with O
support O
for O
color), O
then O
code O
execution O
could O
be O
possible O
as O
the O
terminal O
would O
interpret O
the O
ansi O
escape O
sequences O
contained O
in O
the O
printer O
name O
. O
in O
the O
past O
, O
we O
treated O
those O
as O
security O
bugs O
in O
terminals O
, O
not O
bugs O
in O
the O
application O
producing O
the O
data O
that O
triggers O
these O
bugs O
. O

or O
without O

translator O
, O

description O
says O
: O

subject: O
re: O
linux B-PRO

futex O
local O

thu O

from O

<kees@... O

, O

, O

at O

+0400 O
, O
solar O

wrote O
: O
this O
was O

via O

, O
hence O

. O

was O

today O
, O
and O
is O
included O
in O
this O
debian O
advisory O
: O
https://lists.debian.org/debian-security-announce/2014/msg00130.html O
cve-2014-3153 O
pinkie O
pie O
discovered O
an O
issue O
in O
the O
futex O
subsystem O
that O
allows O
a O
local O
user O
to O
gain O
ring O
0 O
control O
via O
the O
futex O
syscall O
. O
an O
unprivileged O
user O
could O
use O
this O
flaw O
to O
crash O
the O
kernel O
(resulting O
in O
denial O
of O
service O
) O
or O
for O
privilege O
escalation O
. O
specifically O
, O
the O
futex O
syscall O
can O
leave O
a O
queued O
kernel O
waiter O
hanging O
on O
the O
stack O
. O
by O
manipulating O
the O
stack O
with O
further O
syscalls O
, O
the O
waiter O
structure O
can O
be O
altered O
. O
when O
later O
woken O
up O
, O
the O
altered O
waiter O
can O
result O
in O
arbitrary O
code O
execution O
in O
ring O
0 O
. O
this O
flaw O
is O
especially O
urgent O
to O
fix O
because O
futex O
tends O
to O
be O
available O
within O
most O
linux O
sandboxes O
(because O
it O
is O
used O
as O
a O
glibc B-VULPART
pthread O
primitive). O

kees O
cook O

subject: O

>>> O

of O

>> O
'fprintd O
' O
does O
not O
encrypt O
sensitive O
information O
before O
storage O
. O
: O
missing O
encryption O
of O
sensitive O
data O
> O
[...] O
> O
this O
misses O
the O
point O
. O
* O
encryption O
shifts O
the O
problem O
to O
protecting O
the O
symmetric O
key O
, O
which O
> O

is O
the O
very O
same O
problem O
. O

other O

, O
but O
not O
> O

this O
one O
. O
* O

to O

> O

. O

> O
 O

, O

> O

errors O
. O
google O
"store O

ios O

> O

are O
suitable O
solutions O
. O
mostly O
: O
your O
fingerprint O
is O
not O
a O

like O
a O

, O
it O
is O
a O
username O
. O

can't O
change O
the O
fingerprint O
(biometrics O
problem), O

is O

. O

touch O
. O
the O
glass O

has O
your O

. O

. O

subject: O
kubernetes: B-PRO
cve-2020-8559: O
privilege O
escalation O
from O
compromised O
node O
oss-security@...ts.openwall.com O
to O
cluster O
a O
security O
issue O
was O
discovered O
in O
the O
kube-apiserver O
that O
could O
enable O
a O
privilege O
escalation O
from O
a O
compromised O
node O
. O
this O
issue O
has O
been O
rated O
medium O
( O
cvss:3.1/av:n O
if O
an O
attacker O
is O
able O
to O
intercept O
certain O
requests O
to O
the O
kubelet O
, O
they O
can O
send O
a O
redirect O
response O
that O
may O
be O
followed O
by O
a O
client O
using O
the O
credentials O
from O
the O
original O
request O
. O
this O
can O
lead O
to O
compromise O
of O
other O
nodes O
. O
if O
multiple O
clusters O
share O
the O
same O
certificate O
authority O
trusted O
by O
the O
client O
, O
and O
the O
same O
authentication O
credentials O
, O
this O
vulnerability O
may O
allow O
an O
attacker O
to O
redirect O
the O
client O
to O
another O
cluster O
. O
in O
this O
configuration O
, O
this O
vulnerability O
should O
be O
considered O
high O
severity O
. O
am O
i O
vulnerable O
? O
you O
are O
only O
affected O
by O
this O
vulnerability O
if O
you O
treat O
the O
node O
as O
a O
security O
boundary O
, O
or O
if O
clusters O
share O
certificate O
authorities O
and O
authentication O
credentials O
. O
note O
that O
this O
vulnerability O
requires O
an O
attacker O
to O
first O
compromise O
a O
node O
through O
separate O
means O
. O
how O
do O
i O
mitigate O
this O
vulnerability O
? O
to O
mitigate O
this O
vulnerability O
you O
must O
upgrade O
the O
kube-apiserver O
to O
a O
patched O
version O
. O
proxied O
backends O
(such O
as O
an O
extension O
api O
server O
) O
that O
respond O
to O
upgrade O
requests O
with O
a O
non-101 O
response O
code O
may O
be O
broken O
by O
this O
patch O
. O
to O
upgrade O
, O
refer O
to O
the O
documentation O
: O
https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/cluster-management/#upgrading-a-cluster O
detection O
upgrade O
requests O
should O
never O
respond O
with O
a O
redirect O
. O
if O
any O
of O
the O
following O
requests O
have O
a O
response O
code O
in O
the O
300-399 O
range O
, O
it O
may O
be O
evidence O
of O
exploitation O
. O
this O
information O
can O
be O
found O
in O
the O
kubernetes O
audit O
logs O
. O
any O
resource O
: O
proxy O
if O
you O
find O
evidence O
that O
this O
vulnerability O
has O
been O
exploited O
, O
please O
contact O
security@...ernetes.io O
additional O
details O
see O

github O
issue O
for O
